words: But you could probably get away with a coat and no tie.
(Rory goes back outside where Lane is waiting.)
(Cut to Lorelai making a dress on a dressmaker's dummy. While she's bending down, she falls over, bringing the dummy down on top of her.)
(Lorelai gets up and goes to answer the door.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, God bless. I've been working so hard to finish Rory's dress I haven't been to get out.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know. Rory's dress made a pass at me and I think I pulled something getting up.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Here, sit, sit sit. Hey, you know what, I've got an Ace bandage in my bag. I'm not sure how we can wrap it but maybe we can do something kind of creative and --
(Sookie pulls bottles of pills out of her purse.)

speaker: SOOKIE
words: OK, I've got Percodan, Vicodin, Darvocet, and, uh...Take this one. It's a muscle relaxer. Very mild, I promise.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: OK. I've got to go. You sure you're going to be OK?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm fine, Mom, I just stubbed my toe.

speaker: EMILY
words: Maybe you should get rid of some of that clutter in your living room.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, you know, I've seen the light. Everything goes. What else have you got?

speaker: EMILY
words: I want to talk about Rory's dance. It's just killing me that she's not going.

speaker: EMILY
words: It may seem frivolous and silly to her now but belive me, these are the kind of experiences you regret missing later.

speaker: EMILY
words: And regret can make you bitter. Do you want Rory to be bitter?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What, Mom? She can make some cash off of it. Become a crazy Oscar Levant kind of celebrity, go on talk shows, heckle Regis.

speaker: EMILY
words: I wish you would take this seriously.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, Rory is going to the dance.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm making her dress right now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, so she'll look really ugly and people will point and throw rocks.

speaker: EMILY
words: Why don't you let me buy her a dress?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, you were thrilled five seconds ago, remember?

speaker: EMILY
words: You're not using the curtains are you?

speaker: EMILY
words: Just one more thing. Take a picture of Rory for me, will you please?

speaker: EMILY
words: On the stairs. And one by the front door. And one as she's getting ready, you know, putting her hair up, putting her makeup on?

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK, do you want one when she's shaving her legs? You know, one leg up in the tub, waving the disposable razor in the air?

speaker: EMILY
words: This is a once in a lifetime event. You get to be there and I don't.
(Lorelai lies down on the floor, trying to get comfortable.)

speaker: EMILY
words: I figure if I got enough pictures I could at least line them up in chronological order and pretend I was there.

speaker: EMILY
words: Maybe bind them together, make a flipbook out of them.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, would you like to come over on Saturday and see Rory go to the dance?

speaker: EMILY
words: Why, what a nice idea, I'd love that, thank you. I'll see you at 7.
(Emily hangs up the phone. Lorelai sighs.)
(Tristin walks up to the table where Paris is selling tickets to the Chilton Winter Formal.)

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Nah, what am I thinking? You wouldn't be free this close to the dance.
(He hands her some money and she hands him the tickets.)

speaker: PARIS
words: Yeah, a quarter of an inch.
(Tristin walks down the hall to where Rory is reading while waiting in line to buy tickets.)

speaker: TRISTIN
words: And she's reading again. How novel.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Did you get the novel thing? Because...

speaker: TRISTIN
words: The guy's supposed to buy the tickets.

speaker: RORY
words: Really. Does Susan Faludi know about this?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Unless of course there is no guy.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, what can I say? I like 'em cheap. Sloppy too -- bald spot, beer gut, you know, and the pants that kind of slip down in the back, giving you that good plumber shot. That sends me through the roof.

speaker: RORY
words: How many languages can you say 'none of your business' in.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Does he go to this school?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Uh-huh. Well, look, OK, I'll confess something to you. I don't have a date.

speaker: RORY
words: Well I hear Squeaky Fromme is up for parole soon. You should keep a good thought.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Well I actually thought you'd like to go with me.

speaker: RORY
words: You did not because you are not stupid.

speaker: RORY
words: Slimy and weasely, yes, but stupid, no. You'd have to be stupid to think that, given our history, I would ever, barring a piano or a safe falling on my head, want to go anywhere with you, ever.

speaker: RORY
words: I'll send her a condolence card.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Yeah. Well at least she won't be buying her own ticket.
(Tristin walks down the hall. Rory is next in line.)

speaker: PARIS
words: He was totally nice to you and you couldn't be a bigger jerk.

speaker: RORY
words: You like Tristin so much, you go out with him.

speaker: PARIS
words: What am I, your Versateller? Wait for change. (yells at the boy sitting next to her) I need change! Now! (to Rory) There's no way you're going with someone better than Tristin.

speaker: PARIS
words: You probably don't even have a date. You're probably going to come down with some very rare form of flu that only hits losers on dance night.

speaker: RORY
words: You know what? I don't want my change. Money makes people shallow.

speaker: PARIS
words: I've got your change. Hey! Hey! If you think I'm keepig this dollar, I'm not!
(Saturday night. Lorelai is sitting on the couch reading a magazine.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're 16. You have skin like a baby's ass. There's nothing to primp.
(Rory comes into the room wearing her dress for the dance.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow. Someone hit you with a pretty stick.

speaker: RORY
words: This dress is amazing. You outdid yourself.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's beautiful, babe, you look beautiful. Come here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes. Hm. I think my favorite part is the shoes.

speaker: RORY
words: I'll just throw them on on my way out

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, you should put them on now and let your feet get really numb.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Go get me the hair spray.
(Rory runs to get her shoes. The doorbell rings.)

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I got extra hot sauce and a couple of extra burritos to put in the fridge in case you get hungry later.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You take such good care of me.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: (gasps) Oh my God! You're a movie star! I'm serious. Oh my -- At some point tonight, walk down a flight of stairs. Movie stars always walk down staircases.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK, come on, let me spray while you try to figure out what she just said.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You, don't move. I got it.
(Sookie points the bottle in the wrong direction and ends up spraying her eyes instead of Rory's hair.)

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah, sweetie, hand that to your mother, and my eyelashes are all stuck together.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honey, are you sure you're alright?

speaker: LORELAI
words: (to Rory) Shield the tacos. OK, ready?
(Rory puts the tacos under the table and covers her eyes. Lorelai sprays her hair.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK, that will be good for six slow dances, four medium ones, one lambada, but if you plan on doing any moshing I suggest another coat.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Rory, sweetie, is this soap by the sink in the silver bottle?

speaker: EMILY
words: We're in here? That's how you answer the door?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well I was all out of Saran Wrap.

speaker: EMILY
words: I don't even want to figure that one out. I just want to see my granddaughter. Where is she?

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh, perfect. I want to be all ready for the big entrance. How's the light in here? Never mind. I'll just take one with the flash and one without to make sure we got it right.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow, Mom, look at you. You'd think Anne Taylor was having a sale or something.
(Emily, armed with a camera, gets into position.)

speaker: EMILY
words: OK, Rory, come in here please.
(Rory comes into the living room wearing a kitchen towel as a bib and eating a taco.)

speaker: EMILY
words: (to Lorelai) She has lived with you too long.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honey, lose the bib and the taco, put your shoes on, come back out, and let Grandma take the pretty picture.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I walked. (to the staircase) It was nice to see you again, Mrs. Gilmore, or at least make out your shape.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Call in fifteen minutes or I'm sending out a search party.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: (to the wall) And you call me if I can come over and help you up the stairs or something.

speaker: EMILY
words: Why would you need help up the stairs?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No reason. Rory, let's go, your public awaits!

speaker: LORELAI
words: I have a little back spasm, that's it. It's no big deal.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know, Mom, just a normal one.

speaker: EMILY
words: There is nothing normal about a back spasm. The very fact that it has the word spasm in it means it's not normal.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Alright, here she is, Mom, get your camera moving.

speaker: EMILY
words: What? Oh, my, you're gorgeous. Oh! Smile!

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm so glad you decided to buy her a dress.
(Lorelai and Rory exchange a look. A car horn sounds outside.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, come here. Have an amazing time.
(Rory kisses Lorelai and Emily and then Rory runs for the door.)

speaker: RORY
words: I'll chronicle the whole evening for you, I promise. Bye, Grandma.

speaker: EMILY
words: You do not go running out the door when a boy honks.

speaker: EMILY
words: It certainly is not fine. This is not a drive through. She's not fried chicken.

speaker: RORY
words: But I told him to honk and I'd meet him out there. We agreed.

speaker: EMILY
words: I don't care what you told him. If he wants to take you out, he will walk up to this door, and know, and say 'good evening,' and come inside for a moment like any civilized human being would know to do.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Now, Mom, this is silly, I have met him already.

speaker: EMILY
words: We will wait until he comes to the door.

speaker: RORY
words: He doesn't know he's supposed to.
(Rory sighs and crosses her arms. They wait in silence. A minute or so later, Dean honks again.)

speaker: EMILY
words: He's not a very bright boy, is he?
(The doorbell rings. Rory starts to run to the door.)

speaker: EMILY
words: Don't rush. A lady never rushes.

speaker: DEAN
words: Hey, uh, I thought I was supposed to honk.

speaker: EMILY
words: Young man, come in here please.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, Dean, meet my mother, Emily Post.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Great rap session. Alright, you guys are out of here. Have fun.

speaker: EMILY
words: What do you know about this boy?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know that Rory likes him and that his parole officer has high hopes for his rehabilitation.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It is a crazy question, Mom, because if I had knowledge of him being a drinker, he would not be with Rory now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, please relax. Dean is a good kid. Rory's gonna have a great time. You got your pictures and tomorrow I will call you and give you all the details.

speaker: EMILY
words: What are you going to do?

speaker: EMILY
words: Well you certainly can't be left alone.

speaker: EMILY
words: You can barely move. You've been sitting on that couch since I got here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's because this is a right comfy couch.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, no, Mom, you really don't have to do that.

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm not leaving my daughter stranded on the couch. What if you need to get to the bathroom?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't go anymore, Mom. I gave it up cold turkey.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, Mom...Look -- I can stand, OK?

speaker: LORELAI
words: See? I'm up. OK, see? I'm fine.

speaker: EMILY
words: Move. If you're fine, than move.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I can move. This is me moving. (nothing happens) Any second now the moving will begin. (nothing happens) Rats.

speaker: EMILY
words: I'll go start some tea. Please tell me you have something besides Lipton.

speaker: LORELAI
words: (muttering to herself) Oh, a stroke would be so good right about now.
(Cut to Rory and Dean. They are in the car on the way to the dance.)

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe we should just forget about this

speaker: RORY
words: I mean, it's just a dance. What's the big deal?

speaker: RORY
words: And these kids at my school -- awful. Have you seen The Outsiders?

speaker: RORY
words: Just call me Ponyboy. I heard this place is beautiful though -- old and historic.

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe we could just go in for a minute.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know. Why can't I decide? This is stupid. What do you think?

speaker: DEAN
words: I think that you look amazing.

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe just a couple minutes won't hurt.
(Cut to Lorela and Emily. Emily is on the phone. Lorelai is still on the couch.)

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes, Marta. Just make sure everything's locked up before you leave. (pause) No, I won't be home tonight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, Mom, you really, really don't have to do this.

speaker: EMILY
words: Don't be silly. I couldn't possibly leave you alone like this.

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm trying to find the candlesticks I bought you.

speaker: EMILY
words: The Baccarat candlesticks I bought you last year for Christmas. I assumed you stuffed them in the back of the closet somewhere.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, well, no, I did not stuff them in the back of the closet.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well then where are they? I don't see them out.

speaker: LORELAI
words: (hesitantly) Well, see, we didn't actually have a...big use for the crystal candlesticks so I kind of...exchanged them.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's a lamp with a bunch of monkeys on it.

speaker: EMILY
words: Baccarat candlesticks for a moneky lamp?

speaker: LORELAI
words: They're really, really happy monkeys, Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: Where is this lamp? I want to see it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's right there on the desk.
(Emily walks over to the lamp and looks closely at it.)

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh my God! They're holding coconuts and leering!

speaker: EMILY
words: You traded my lovely gift for for a semi-pornographic leering monkey lamp? How could you?

speaker: EMILY
words: This is not just about the bad breeding of returning a gift. This goes right to the heart of the question of taste. You were given something of substance and you cast it off for a ridiculous, slightly sinister barroom decoration. Explain this to me, Lorelai.
(As her mother rants, Lorelai's smile turns to a frown. She sinks lower on the couch and covers herself with a blanket.)
(Cut to the Chilton dance. Rory and Dean are standing near the back of the room.)

speaker: RORY
words: Well it's a very good room.

speaker: RORY
words: I commend the person that suggested this very location.

speaker: DEAN
words: So, we could just get our picture taken and leave.

speaker: DEAN
words: Or we could dance a little first.
(Madeline and Louise are sitting at a table at the dance.)

speaker: MADELINE
words: We have to wait for Paris anyway.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Rory Gilmore. God, she's got good hair.

speaker: LOUISE
words: He's not of the manor born, that's for sure. Let's go.
(Madeline and Louise saunter over to Rory and Dean.)

speaker: RORY
words: So, should we dance or should we sit first?

speaker: LOUISE
words: Rory...you came. Oh, great dress. Who's it by?

speaker: RORY
words: No, my mom made it for me.

speaker: LOUISE
words: So you traveling with a bodyguard now?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, no. This is my -- this is Dean. Dean, this is Louise and Madeline.

speaker: LOUISE
words: You know, my whole family is really tall. The men, mostly. What are you -- 6'1", 6'2"?

speaker: RORY
words: What, does he get like a prize if he guesses?

speaker: MADELINE
words: One kind of soup, actually. It's green, lumpy.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Actually, she can't make soup either.
(Dean moves behind Rory and puts his arms around her waist.)

speaker: DEAN
words: What do you think? Too tall?

speaker: RORY
words: Although the saddle shoes make it kind of difficult.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well I'll just have to stoop then.
(Madeline follows Louise. A slow song starts as Rory turns in Dean's arms.)
(Rory and Dean are about to dance when Paris and her date walk up to them.)

speaker: RORY
words: Hi, I'm Rory. This is Dean.

speaker: DEAN
words: OK, so, this dancing thing is not something I want you to get used to or comment on.

speaker: DEAN
words: Hey, if I kiss you is a nun gonna come out here and boot me out of here
(Tristin is watching Rory and Dean kissing.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, I think somebody already ate that.

speaker: EMILY
words: That is a mashed banana on toast.

speaker: EMILY
words: I used to make this for you all the time when you were a little girl.

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes, whenever you got sick I made this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Are you sure it wasn't the other way around?

speaker: EMILY
words: I'll just take it back to the kitchen

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, Mom, I said I want it.

speaker: EMILY
words: Are you sure? Because I can throw it away.

speaker: EMILY
words: You can't possibly be comfortable like that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mother, please, this is the first position in 24 hours that that has not made me crazy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Please don't make me eat this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, Sookie left me a burrito in the fridge.

speaker: EMILY
words: I'll go warm it up for you.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh. Fine. I'll just go get it then.

speaker: DEAN
words: OK, uh, I need something to drink. Do you want some punch?
(Jacob approaches Rory when Dean goes to get their punch.)

speaker: JACOB
words: Are you having a good time?

speaker: JACOB
words: It's OK. So, was that your boyfriend?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh. I don't know. I'm not sure.

speaker: RORY
words: We've only been going out a little while, so...

speaker: JACOB
words: So, there's still a little room to play?

speaker: JACOB
words: Maybe I could get your number.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm sorry, aren't you here with Paris?

speaker: RORY
words: So maybe you shouldn't be over here asking me for my number then.

speaker: RORY
words: Paris is your cousin? You're related?

speaker: RORY
words: Jacob, it's been very nice to meet you. I hope you have a lovely evening.
(Cut to Lorelai and Emily watching TV.)

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh look -- Barbara Stanwyck. I just love Barbara Stanwyck.

speaker: EMILY
words: She had that wonderful voice -- that husky, deep voice. I just love that voice.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know Mom, you have kind of a Barbara Stanwycky voice.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I mean it. You could have gotten Fred McMurray to off Dad if you'd really wanted to.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh you do enjoy teasing me, don't you?

speaker: EMILY
words: You know, Rory looked so lovely tonight.

speaker: EMILY
words: I just can't get over how she's grown up into that little woman who walked out of here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know. (pause) You know what, Mom?

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, let me get this out of your way. You really don't remember me making this for you when you were sick?

speaker: EMILY
words: Well I did and you loved it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know what? Let me give it a try.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's even more disgusting than I thought it was going to be.
(Emily takes a bite and makes a face.)

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh my God, it's horrible! What on earth was I thinking?

speaker: DEAN
words: So, uh, you want to maybe go?

speaker: RORY
words: You're bored. I'm sorry. Yeah, let's go, right away.

speaker: DEAN
words: I'm not bored. I thought, you know, there's still a little time left, maybe we could get a cup of coffee somewhere, hang out a little, talk a walk. You know, just us.

speaker: DEAN
words: No, you stay. I'll get the coats.
(After Dean leaves, Paris walks up to Rory sitting at the table and leans into her.)

speaker: PARIS
words: So. How many people have you told? Four? Five? Everybody?

speaker: PARIS
words: You know that Jacob is my cousin and now you finally have all the ammunition to pay me back, right?
(The people nearby are starting to stare.)

speaker: RORY
words: I don't want to pay you back. I just want to get awy from you.

speaker: PARIS
words: (voice gets increasingly louder) Now you can just go all over the school and just tell everybody that Paris Geller couldn't get a date to the dance. That she had no one and since she couldn't just not come, she had to get her mother to ask her cousin Jacob to take and then she had to give him gas money to make him do it. Go ahead! Tell them!

speaker: RORY
words: I don't have to. You just did.
(Paris and Rory look around. Everyone has stopped dancing and is listening to them. Paris walks away.)

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah. I wouldn't get quite so excited about it.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Oh, why, did she say something mean?

speaker: DEAN
words: Actually, no, Rory doesn't use words like that. I embellished a little.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Oh so you're the big strong protector? Little princess needs a protector?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Nothing. Just don't like your girlfriend, that's all.

speaker: DEAN
words: Really? Doesn't look that way to me.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: I don't really care how it looks to you.

speaker: DEAN
words: Hey. You got in my path, not the other way around.
(Dean starts to walk away. Tristin steps in his way.)

speaker: DEAN
words: Get out of my way Dristan.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Nothing. Just getting to know your boyfriend here.

speaker: DEAN
words: It's going really well, don't you think?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Oh yeah. We're just about to build a clubhouse.

speaker: RORY
words: OK. Well I hate to break up the party, but we should go.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Oh, why? Little girl's got to be home?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: No, I think you two make a very cute couple. Is your horse and buggy parked outside? Got to get home for the barn raising?
(Dean and Rory start to walk away. Tristin steps in front of Rory. Dean shoves Tristin. People around them stop dancing and start watching the two guys.)

speaker: DEAN
words: What the hell do you think you're doing?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: OK, you will not push me again.

speaker: DEAN
words: Are you seriously trying to act tough? You're wearing a tie for God's sake.

speaker: DEAN
words: I'm not fighting you. It'd be like fighting an accountant. I'll call you when I need my taxes done.
(Tristin lunges for Dean. It takes a few other boys and a man to separate them.)

speaker: DEAN
words: You don't want to fight me Tristin!

speaker: DEAN
words: 'Cause I'll kill you, idiot! Come on, Rory, let's go.
(As Rory and Dean walk away, Tristin breaks free from the people holding him back. Dean turns around and gets in his face.)

speaker: DEAN
words: You will not come near her. Ever again.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Did you really bring your cousin?
(Cut to Lorelai's house. Lorelai is sleeping on the couch. Emily is still watching TV. She reaches over for the remote control.)

speaker: EMILY
words: I'll tell you how it ends.
(Emily tucks Lorelai's hair behind her ear and covers her with a blanket.)
(Emily sits in a chair to read.)
(Cut to Rory and Dean walking outdoors in Stars Hollow.)

speaker: RORY
words: I seriously don't know what got into him.

speaker: DEAN
words: He has a thing for you.

speaker: RORY
words: No he doesn't. It's just a game to him or something.

speaker: DEAN
words: He has a thing for you.

speaker: RORY
words: He does nothing but insult me and make me miserable.

speaker: DEAN
words: He has a thing for you.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know how I feel about this whole situation.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know...having my boyfriend defend my honor. It's weird.

speaker: RORY
words: No! I just meant boyfriend in the sense that the whole defending me thing was very boyfriendy, but only in the broadest sense of the word, which doesn't even apply at all here.

speaker: RORY
words: I didn't mean that you're my boyfriend.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't think you're my boyfriend.

speaker: DEAN
words: In the broadest sense of the word way?

speaker: RORY
words: No, in the real, 'hi this is Dean, my boyfriend' kind of way.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well I am if you want me to be.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm feeling pretty good about this decision.
(The door to Miss Patty's dance studio is open.)

speaker: RORY
words: I guess Miss Patty forgot to lock up.

speaker: DEAN
words: I've never really seen in here before.
(They're inside, looking at the pictures on the walls.)

speaker: DEAN
words: Are all these women really Miss Patty?

speaker: RORY
words: Yep. She said she's done everything there is to do in show business except set fire to the hoop the dog jumps through.

speaker: DEAN
words: I'll get it. God, this weighs a ton. What do you have in here?

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know. A lipstick, five dollar bill. Gum, hair spray, a book.

speaker: DEAN
words: You brought a book to the dance?

speaker: DEAN
words: You thought there'd be a lot of downtime?

speaker: RORY
words: No. I just take a book with me everywhere. It's just habit.

speaker: DEAN
words: So, uh, what are you reading?

speaker: DEAN
words: (reading) 'There's little in taking or giving. There's little in water or wine. This living, this living, this living, Was never a project of mine.' Cheery.
(They settle into a comfortable chair together.)

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you for tonight. It was perfect.
(They kiss then continue to look at the book.)
(Time lapse. They're still asleep. Miss Patty and a large group of women come into the dance studio.)

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: OK, ladies. Grab your yoga mats.

speaker: WOMAN
words: I don't think I'll ever get warm again.
(The women gather around Rory and Dean.)

speaker: WOMAN
words: (shocked) Oh, my goodness! It's Lorelai's girl!

speaker: WOMAN
words: She's over here. Asleep with the bag boy from the market.

speaker: WOMAN #2
words: What are we supposed to do?

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Rory, honey. It's Miss Patty. Rory? Rory, what are you doing here?

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Yes. have you been here all night?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh my God! We fell asleep. How could we have fallen asleep?

speaker: DEAN
words: Calm down, I'll explain it to your mom.

speaker: RORY
words: (hysterical) Where's my purse? Where's my purse?

speaker: DEAN
words: I'm going with you. We'll explain. It'll be OK.

speaker: RORY
words: No you can't come with me. You shouldn't be anywhere near my house right now.

speaker: RORY
words: I know. I just have to get home.

speaker: DEAN
words: Look, please, please let me come with you.
(Rory runs down the street towards home. Dean lets her go.)
(Cut to Lorelai's house. Emily is shaking Lorelai awake.)

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai! Get up. Now. Right now!

speaker: EMILY
words: She's not there. Aren't you listening?

speaker: EMILY
words: Where's the phone? Call the police.

speaker: EMILY
words: What are you doing? Call the police! Call the police!

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm looking for the phone. What do you think I'm doing?

speaker: EMILY
words: Why don't you ever clean up around here? This is an emergency and you can't even find the phone. What if there was a fire? What if Rory was choking?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know that and your yelling is not helping me!
(They continue looking for the phone. It rings)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory? (pause) Oh, Patty. (pause) What? (pause) OK. (pause) Thanks. (pause) No, than you so much. (pause) OK Bye-bye. (hangs up) Rory's OK.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She and Dean were at Miss Patty's.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um, it's a dance studio. That was Patty. She said that she found them asleep and woke them up and Rory's on her way home.

speaker: EMILY
words: In what state were they found in?

speaker: LORELAI
words: She didn't say, OK. Let's just try to be calm until we know what happened.

speaker: EMILY
words: What do you mean 'until we know what happened'? We know what happened.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai Gilmore, I've watched you do a lot of stupid things in your life and I have held my tongue.

speaker: EMILY
words: But I will not stand by and let you allow that girl to ruin her life.

speaker: EMILY
words: She spent the night out with that boy, the one you let her run off to that dance with.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, so help me God, I will not get into this with you.

speaker: EMILY
words: She's doing the same thing you did.

speaker: EMILY
words: She's gonna ruin everything just like you did.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No she's not! No she's not! No she's not! Rory is a good kid, Mom! She's not me.

speaker: EMILY
words: What kind of mother are you to allow this to happen to her?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, I don't know, Mom. What kind of mother were you?

speaker: EMILY
words: You're going to lose her. You're going to lose her just like I lost you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I am not going to lose her. Do you hear me? Even if I hadn't gotten pregnant, you still would have lost me. I had nothing in that house. I had no life. I had no air. You strangled me. I do not strangle Rory.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh you're so perfect and I was so horrible. I put you in good schools. I gave you the best of everything. I made sure you had the finest opportunities. And I am so tired of hearing about how you were suffocated and I was so controlling. Well if I was so controlling why couldn't I control you running around getting pregnant and throwing your life away.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You will not come into my house and tell me I threw my life away. Look around, Mom. This is a life. It has a little color in it so it may look a little unfamiliar to you, but it's a life. And if I hadn't gotten pregnant I wouldn't have Rory.
(Rory sneaks in the front door and hides by the stairs.)

speaker: EMILY
words: You know that's not what I meant.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Maybe I was some horrible uncontrollable child like you say, but Rory isn't. She's smart and careful and I trust her and she's gonna be fine and if you can't accept that or believe it, then I don't want you in this house!
(Emily walks out and slams the door. Rory creeps into the kitchen.)

speaker: RORY
words: Mom, thank you for saying all those --

speaker: LORELAI
words: What were you thinking? Staying out all night! Are you insane?

speaker: RORY
words: I'm sorry. It was an accident.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're talking to the queen of staying out all night. I invented the concept! This is no accident! You can't do this! Period.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you have any idea what it's like to wake up with my mother here and find out that you never came home?

speaker: RORY
words: So all this is about Grandma being here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, it's about the feeling of complete terror when your kid isn't in her bed in the morning.

speaker: LOREAI
words: And then it's about a whole different kind of terror when you find out that she spent the night with some guy.

speaker: RORY
words: I didn't spend the night with him. We fell asleep.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You are going on the pill.

speaker: RORY
words: What happened to all that stuff you said to Grandma What happened to trusting me? Where did all that go?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I think it's back on Patty's yoga mats.

speaker: RORY
words: This is crap! You know I didn't do anything. You know this is an accident. You're just mad because I screwed up and I did it in front of Grandma and she nailed you for it. Well I'm sorry. I'm sorry that I screwed up and I'm sorry that you got yelled at, but I didn't do anything and you know it!
(Rory goes into her room and slams the door. Lorelai sits at the kitchen table and cries.)

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: People please pay attention. Now, I want my before Mary over here, and my after Mary over here. Wise men, shepherd line up for the processional. I only have half a donkey? I need the rest of the donkey!
[Kirk standing on stool while Lorelai hemming]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, be quiet now. [looks at Rory]

speaker: RORY
words: Um, Taylor, the baby Jesus is missing an arm again.

speaker: RORY
words: I was just getting it out of the trunk and -

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Let me see that. Oh for Pete’s sake! [to everyone] Ok listen up! The arm is missing! I repeat the arm is missing!

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe it’s just time to get a new baby Jesus, you know, one that’s a boy.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: It’s a doll, no one can tell.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: This has been the baby Jesus in every Christmas pageant since 1965. Were you here in 1965?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Find the arm [Rory looks at Lorelai]

speaker: KIRK
words: You stuck me once. There’s nothing to say you won’t do it again.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok you know what? You’re done.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Taylor come quickly. Our ‘before’ Mary is about to become an ‘after’. Who else in town is knocked up?
[Lorelai and Rory look at each other awkwardly then look away. Pan to them leaving]

speaker: LORELAI
words: [sourly]It’s beginning to look a lot like Christmas. [pan to dog with doll arm in mouth]
CUT TO RORY STANDING IN A GAZEBO

speaker: LANE
words: Hey, I thought we were meeting at Luke’s.

speaker: RORY
words: We were? Oh my God, I’m so sorry. I forgot.

speaker: LANE
words: Let me guess. You and Lorelai haven’t made up yet?

speaker: RORY
words: Nope. Things are still Miracle Worker at my house. God, how did everything get so screwed up?

speaker: LANE
words: I think you staying out all night with Dean had something to do with it.

speaker: RORY
words: And my grandmother being there to witness it didn’t help.

speaker: RORY
words: It sucks. Things were good. School was good, Dean was good. Now my mother and I are barely speaking. Mom and Grandma are barely speaking. Dean’s new name is ‘Narcolepsy boy’.

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t know. I haven’t talked to him since it happened.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok, I really need to talk about something else now.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes I did. I got a mow-ing cow shaped timer for Sookie, some cardio-salsa tapes for Michel, a book for Dean -

speaker: LANE
words: I know I’ve always dreamed that some day a guy would get me a really confusing Czechoslovakian novel.

speaker: LANE
words: A book sends the wrong message.

speaker: LANE
words: You have to look at what a gift says to the other person, not to you. Remember two years ago, I got my mom that perfume?

speaker: LANE
words: Ok, to me that said, ‘Hey mom, you work hard, you deserve something fancy’. Now to my mother, it said ‘Hey mom, here’s some smelly sex juice, the kind I use to lure boys with’ and resulted in me being sent to Bible camp all summer.

speaker: LANE
words: Just imaging that you actually gave Dean something really romantic, and he gave you a football. Your hypothetical romantic present is saying that you really, really like him. And his present is saying ‘Hey man, let’s just be friends’.

speaker: RORY
words: And you’re saying that this book is -

speaker: RORY
words: So then what do I get him?

speaker: LANE
words: What you should do is find out what he’s getting you and gauge your gift accordingly.

speaker: RORY
words: But doesn’t that kinda take the fun out of it?

speaker: LANE
words: Gift giving is serious business. If you don’t believe me try spending a month at Korean Bible camp.

speaker: GUY
words: And you don’t want to move her.

speaker: MICHEL
words: I would prefer that you didn’t.

speaker: GUY
words: Ok, so we’re still looking for a fairy.

words: No chance you’re going to help me.

speaker: EMILY
words: I wanted to talk to you about the Christmas dinner this Friday.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well mom, there’s been a lot going on around here lately, your Christmas shindig’s not exactly high on my list of things to obsess about.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well I’m sorry if the timing is bad Lorelai, but the world doesn’t always revolve around you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I probably won’t be there for cocktails.

words: Because it’s not in my job description.

speaker: EMILY
words: Don’t come. It’s obviously an enormous burden for you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’re telling me not to come to the Christmas party?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I had the German measles in the 5th grade, I still had to show up to the Christmas party.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai let’s be honest here, I’m not too happy with you right now and I assume you’re not too happy with me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: My polka dot dress matched my face and still I had to sit through 12 courses.

speaker: EMILY
words: I am tired of forcing you to do all those terrible things that infringe upon your life and I do not have the energy to pretend that the way you treated my the other day was in any way acceptable.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So you’re uninviting me to Christmas dinner?

words: Ok well, great mom, it’s been swell talking to you.

words: I wish you’d change your mind.

words: It’s not my mind that needs to be changed.

words: I don’t think she meant it.

words: And without a map to follow that reasoning I say, ‘Take a hot it’s cold outside’.

words: You just wanna hold a grudge.

words: Never saw her on the running track.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t remember the country club organizing a Tae-bo class.

words: Fine, forget it. Should I put your name on Grandma’s present?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, sign it the inn keeper formally known as her daughter.

words: Well what about the apple tarts? You wait all year for those apple tarts.

words: I can live without the apple tarts.

words: You’ve made up songs after eating five of them with lyrics that contradict that last statement.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh you know what? You have to go, you’re late.

words: What, I’m sorry, is somebody speaking? Couldn’t be Rory, she’s already half way to Hartford.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Drive carefully. Watch out for ice. And bring me back one of those [door closes]..tarts!

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory, come in. You look lovely.

speaker: RORY
words: This is from me and mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well aren’t you thoughtful? I’ll just put it under the tree.

speaker: RORY
words: You know mom actually picked it out.

words: Rory, do you know Holland Prescott?

words: Yes, I know. Henry toned it down a little.

words: Henry did! Henry is a toddler!

speaker: ALAN
words: He thought your take was a little conservative.

speaker: ALAN
words: Richard, be very careful. This man may be our boss one day.

speaker: ALAN
words: Over by the apple tarts I assume.

words: No, she had to work. [Rory looks at her]

words: Ah. Speaking of which, I’m going to give that man a call.

words: Richard, you’re getting yourself all worked up.

speaker: RICHARD
words: As long as I’ve been with this company, it has been run by gentleman. Revising a man’s work without so much as a phone call would’ve been unheard of!

speaker: ALAN
words: It’s a new world out there Richard.

speaker: EMILY
words: Please stop all this shop talk. We are here to celebrate.

speaker: ALAN
words: Richard, it’s past midnight in London.

words: Grandma, could I talk to you alone please.

speaker: RORY
words: I want to apologize about the other night.

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory please, this is a party.

speaker: RORY
words: I messed up, it’s my fault.

speaker: EMILY
words: This is not the time or place to discuss this, your mother should have taught you that.

speaker: RORY
words: Please don’t be mad at her.

speaker: EMILY
words: I’m not mad at anyone. Now go back in and join the party.

speaker: EMILY
words: And take this to Gigi on your way back.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes Joe, I know it’s Friday night, but I ordered my pizza an hour ago...Oh no I did not hear about the delivery van...Well I am very, very sorry to hear that. Now was it a fairly new van? Great, ok, well Joe, as with most tragedies in life there come a time when you just need to pick up and move one. So what’s the next phase of the delivery saga? Mm-hmm...Well how long until your brother’s back with the razor scooter? Ok, uh-huh, alright, just call me when it gets there. Bye Joe.

[Goes into the kitchen, grams a salad bag, pours dressing into it, shakes it and sits down to read a magazine and eat. Hears a knocking at Rory’s window. Goes into Rory’s room and sees Dean at the window. Opens window]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good, good. Shouldn’t you have a squeegee with you or something?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm-hmm [goes to close window but Dean hasn’t moved] Something else?

words: I just wanted to say that things got all messed up.

speaker: DEAN
words: We sat down and we were reading this book and then we fell asleep.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Pick a more interesting book next time.

speaker: DEAN
words: So am I like public enemy #1 with you?

words: Please just tell me where I stand.

words: I don’t know where you stand ok? All I know is my 16 year old daughter didn’t come home one night and you had something to do with that.

words: Look you can hate me but you have to believe me, I would not let anything happen to her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know, I was 16 when I had Rory.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That is the same age she is now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She wants to go to Harvard.

speaker: DEAN
words: She will go to Harvard and if she doesn’t it won’t be because of me. [sighs and stands to leave]

words: No. Though I did imagine 20 different ways to remove your head from your body.

words: Yeah? Well which one looked the best?

words: Well, I mean sure you wouldn’t want it to go quick.

words: You know we have a really nice front door. You might want to use it some times.

words: No, Chuck rings on 2, you ring on 3.

speaker: DIRECTOR
words: From the top. [they start again] Henry!

words: I’d really rather not talk about it right now.

words: Just tell me you forbid her to see the bag boy.

words: First time I looked at him, I thought he was trouble.

words: Excuse me, I’m the one who told you I thought he was trouble and you told me you thought I was crazy.

words: You are crazy and he is trouble.

words: He is not trouble! He’s 6’2...he’s beautiful and he’s completely in love with my daughter.

words: Wait. Can I see a menu?

words: You need to see a menu?

words: I know, but I usually order the same thing, and tonight I’m in the mood for something a little different.

words: Emily, you’ve out done yourself yet again.

speaker: ALAN
words: Yes, I can’t imagine the hours you spent slaving over a hot stove.

speaker: EMILY
words: A compliment for my chef is a compliment for me, thank you Alan.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I for one would like to know where Henry is at this hour. Probably gallivanting around London like a bull out to stud.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well how is he supposed to negotiate the contract tomorrow morning if he’s been out at all hours with some cheap tramp.

speaker: EMILY
words: This is wildly inappropriate dinner conversation especially in front of a young lady.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Is it unbearably hot in here?

speaker: EMILY
words: Richard don’t loosen your tie at the table.

speaker: HOLLAND
words: So what are your plans for the Christmas holidays Rory?

speaker: RORY
words: I’ll probably just be hanging out with my mom.

speaker: GIGI
words: Oh it’s such a shame she couldn’t come, she’s always such a kick.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai wasn’t feeling well so I suggested she stay home.

speaker: RICHARD
words: It is hot in here, I’m going to lower the thermostat [leaves].

speaker: HOLLAND
words: Poor thing, what’s wrong with her?

speaker: EMILY
words: She has a touch of the flu. Richard forget the thermostat! [Rory looks at her again]

speaker: GIGI
words: I thought you said she was working?

speaker: EMILY
words: Well she was supposed to work but then she caught the flu so one way or another she couldn’t have made it.

speaker: EMILY
words: Richard! For heaven sake [getting up to find him]. Richard!
[Slides a Santa face hamburger in front of Lorelai]

speaker: LORELAI
words: You made me a Santa burger.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He has a hat and everything.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, I just cut a piece of wonder bread, you know, poured a little ketchup, piped on a little cream cheese.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No one has ever made me something quite this disgusting before. I thank you.
[Cell phone rings. Luke point at the ‘no cell phone’ sign]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Are you kidding? It’s like the North Pole out there.

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey, this sign isn’t just a decoration.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honey, nothing in here is a decoration.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh really? Maybe we should take a vote. [to customers] Who thinks we shouldn’t use cell phones in here? [all raise their hands] Well screw democracy. [goes to answer but stops ringing] Perfect, Now I have to check my voice mail.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Well we were caroling around town and we got a bit chilly and we thought maybe we could trade you a song for some hot chocolate.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: No no, we’ll sing for it, any tune you like.

speaker: LUKE
words: And then I give you free hot chocolate.

speaker: LUKE
words: Tell you want, you can have your hot chocolate, and pay for it, then go next door and sing for the marshmallows.

speaker: LUKE
words: Shut up Taylor. What’s going on? [to Lorelai]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, he collapsed or something. I don’t know. I need a cab. I need to call a cab. Where’s the phone? I need - can anyone give me - I’m holding a phone.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No I can’t calm down. I need a cab. What’s the numbers? God, it’s something-cabs, cabs-something-something, 1-800-cabs? Can somebody tell me the damn number of the cab guy?!

speaker: LORELAI
words: But there’s food and there’s people and there’s a burger with a face.

speaker: LUKE
words: Ok, everybody out! We’re closed, let’s go. Food’s on me. [to Lorelai] Put on your coat and get your stuff. [to Taylor] Taylor, have your hot chocolate then lock up. [to Lorelai] Come on, my truck’s out back.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We’re being passed by senior citizens.

speaker: LUKE
words: I’m going as fast as I can.

speaker: LUKE
words: There’s ice on the road, those people aren’t being safe.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well maybe they’re not being safe but at least they’re getting somewhere.

speaker: LUKE
words: You checked it five times already, I’ve listened to it twice, it’s not changing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: ‘Grandpa’s in the hospital, please come.’ No details, no info. Who taught her to leave a message like that?

speaker: LUKE
words: I’m sure she was in a hurry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: A person needs details. Why is he in the hospital? How bad is it? What are the circumstances involving him being in the hospital? These are simple questions.

speaker: LUKE
words: We’ll be there very soon and you’ll know everything.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, you’re psychic now? You’re suddenly getting visions while you’re driving 20 mph in the oldest truck known to man? [pause] I’m sorry, you’re killing yourself to get me there and I’m yelling at you. I don’t mean it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I feel like this is one of those moments when I should be remembering all the great times I had with my dad, you know. The time he took me shopping for a Barbie or to the circus or fishing and my mind is a complete blank.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No it didn’t. We never did any of that. He went to work, he came home, he read the paper, he went to bed, I snuck out the window. Simple. He was a very by the numbers guy. I was never very good with numbers.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know my dad is not a bad guy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He lived his life the way he thought he was supposed to. He followed the rules taught to him by his non-fishing-non-Barbie-buying dad. He worked hard. He bought a nice house. He provided for my mom. All he asked in return was for his daughter to wear white dresses and go to cotillion and want the same life that he had. What a disappointment it must have been for him to get me.

speaker: LUKE
words: I can’t imagine anyone seeing you as a disappointment.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I bet you’d buy a Barbie for your daughter.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, well, I’d probably give her the cash to buy it herself and meet her by the baseball cards.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm. You’ll make a great dad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. It’s just the uh, daughter part I don’t have down yet.

speaker: LUKE
words: Ok, hold on. That Camaro is dust.

speaker: EMILY
words: But why can’t I see him.?

speaker: EMILY
words: Well I would like to meet this doctor who’s testing him.

speaker: EMILY
words: Some strange man is working on my husband, I have a right to meet this person.

speaker: EMILY
words: And I want to see the room you’re going to put him in.

speaker: EMILY
words: And stop saying ‘You will’. Put a proper sentence together for God’s sake.

speaker: EMILY
words: Please! They run this place like the CIA [Joshua comes up] Joshua, thank God! This place is infuriating.

speaker: JOSHUA
words: It’s alright, I’m here, I’m going to check on him right now. Have you filled out the forms yet?

speaker: EMILY
words: I don’t care about the forms, I want to see my husband.

speaker: JOSHUA
words: Let me see what’s going on and then we’ll take it from there.

speaker: EMILY
words: And there he goes through the doors.

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe I should call mom again.

speaker: EMILY
words: Never mind, I’m sure she’s very busy.

speaker: RORY
words: That’s not true, I bet she’d -

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory, go get your Grandfather a paper -

speaker: EMILY
words: The Wall Street Journal or Barron’s. Whatever they have, he’ll want something to read when he gets back to his room.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok, can I get you something? Maybe a coffee?
[Grandma goes around the corner and calls Lorelai’s house but gets the answering machine and hangs up. Goes back to the waiting area]

speaker: NURSE
words: Ms. Gilmore, uh, I need you to -

speaker: EMILY
words: It’s not ‘Ms. Gilmore’, it’s Mrs. Gilmore! Mrs. Gilmore, I’m not a cosmo woman!

speaker: NURSE
words: I know this is difficult for you, but if you don’t fill out these forms -

speaker: EMILY
words: What? You’ll do what? I’d like to hear in your most condescending tone what my punishment will be for not filling out these forms in a timely manner. Are there bamboo shoots involved? Some sort of dark deep hole in the ground? Rats nibbling at my toes?
[Pan to Lorelai and Luke in the hospital]

speaker: LUKE
words: Ok, we’re supposed to follow the blue line, around the corner and then we should be -

speaker: LORELAI
words: Where’s the scarecrow when you need him?

speaker: LUKE
words: Ok, we have to ask someone else.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No! No! We just have to pick one.

speaker: LUKE
words: Ah, well can’t just wander around here aimlessly.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke, listen to me, somewhere in this hospital are my mother and my father. Now I know I don’t get along with them but there has to be some sort of intuition, some sort of blood bond that will somehow lead me to them.

speaker: EMILY
words: My great uncle founded this hospital -

speaker: EMILY
words: You insensitive paper peddler! His portrait is hanging in the lobby, go look. It’s right above the sign that says ‘Founder’!!!

speaker: LORELAI
words: What’s going on? How is he?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well of course I came. How’s dad?

speaker: EMILY
words: That’s what I’ve been trying to find out but this woman keeps pestering me with idiotic questions like ‘What’s the number of my insurance policy and how long have we had it.’

speaker: NURSE
words: I need to get this information.

speaker: EMILY
words: You need to get sensitivity training!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, what if I fill out this information and you can go find someone who can tell us how my dad is.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Or, I could go and you can stay here and continue to discuss this with my mother

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, so tell me what happened.

speaker: EMILY
words: I don’t know what happened. He was hot and he went to turn down the thermostat and then - [see Luke] were you on a date?

speaker: LUKE
words: Which is her way of saying we weren’t on a date.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m sorry, I didn’t mean it like that.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well how am I supposed to know you weren’t on a date. It’s Friday night and you show up here with a man.

speaker: EMILY
words: It’s not insane to assume a date was involved.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’re right, ok, it’s entirely possible that I was out on a date.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I was eating at Luke’s when I got the message. He gave me a ride, end of story. Is Dr. Reynolds here?

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes, Joshua got her a while ago. He was supposed to come back the minute he knew something but he hasn’t been back yet.

speaker: EMILY
words: You can’t find him! You can’t find anyone! Everyone just keeps disappearing behind those doors!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well come on, let’s go [goes through doors]

speaker: EMILY
words: I didn’t know you could do that. [follows Lorelai]

speaker: LUKE
words: I gave your mom a ride. We weren’t on a date.

speaker: LUKE
words: She and your grandmother just went back to see if they can find a doctor.

speaker: RORY
words: Did they find out anything else about Grandpa?

speaker: LUKE
words: I don’t think so, but give your mom a couple of minutes back there, I bet she finds something out.

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t want him to die.

speaker: LUKE
words: Well you tell him that when you see him ok? People like to hear that.

speaker: RORY
words: It was horrible! It happened so fast.

speaker: LORELAI
words: They’re about to bring him out of the big test room any minute so just hang in there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Kicking some patient out of the room with the good view.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I hope they get him unhooked fast, otherwise he’s going without the life support machine.

speaker: RORY
words: So how long before they bring him back?

speaker: RORY
words: Like get some coffee or make phone calls or do something that isn’t standing here waiting.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, go it. Well as partial as I am to the phone, I’m voting for the ‘get coffee’ idea.

speaker: RORY
words: I was just getting to know him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He’s not. Go get your coffee. [Rory leaves] Oh man! [sits with Luke]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, well it’s my turn. God this sucks.

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey come on, you gotta think positive here - bright side, good thoughts. Rainbows, unicorns, clowns, little cute...furry - ok I’m out.

speaker: EMILY
words: Alright, we’ve secured him the room but the pillows are completely unacceptable. I’m gonna see if I can find him some down ones and some slippers. I’ll be right back.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We’ll be right here [gurney passes. Luke breathes deeply, head back] Jeez are you ok?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, I’m just not big on hospitals you know the smell, people being wheeled by with tubes sticking out of them, you know, drainage, fluids, gaping holes -

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, listen, why don’t you go home.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That’s not what I meant. You know you always look good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I mean you always look healthy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But you don’t look so healthy now. Now you look...

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh what? So I said you look good. We’re not in 5th grade. ‘You look good’, big deal. Stop staring at me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: See that’s what you get for being cocky.

speaker: ORDERLY
words: He’s a little groggy right now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What’s going on? How are the tests?

speaker: ORDERLY
words: The doctor will have to tell you that, I’m just the transport guy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: When is the doctor coming out?

speaker: ORDERLY
words: I’m not sure but you can go in with your dad until he gets here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That’s ok, uh, I’m gonna go find my mom and Rory and tell them he’s back up.

speaker: LUKE
words: I can tell them when they get here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That’s ok, uh, I think they’d like to know now [turns around and almost knocks over her mom] Ah!

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, you almost ran me over.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, good thing we’re in a hospital.

speaker: LORELAI
words: To find you, they just brought dad up.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well how is he? Did you talk to him?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No not yet, I was coming to find you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You go ahead mom, I’m gonna go find Rory.

speaker: LUKE
words: You know I could look for Rory.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No that’s ok, I’ll do it.

speaker: LUKE
words: I thought so. Hey look, it’s Rory. [Rory comes up to them]

speaker: RORY
words: The coffee machine was jammed so I got us some chicken soup and some Pez.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I was just coming to look for you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: They just brought Grandpa back up. He’s in room 202.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You go ahead, I just - I have to make a call.

speaker: LUKE
words: So who are you gonna go find now?

speaker: LUKE
words: How about Jimmy Hoffa? That’ll keep you busy for a while.

speaker: LUKE
words: You can’t avoid going into that room forever.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m not avoiding anything. I’m going to find coffee.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You have no idea what you’re talking about.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No you know what hurts? Having a screwdriver jammed in the side of your head [pointing behind Luke]

speaker: RORY
words: ‘Year end optimism in recent earnings reports, have pushed shares of the telecommunications giant about $65’.

speaker: RORY
words: ‘However, some experts say that the stock is dangerously overvalued.’

speaker: EMILY
words: [Comes into room] Well how are we doing?

speaker: RORY
words: We’re done the front page of the Financial Times and all of The Wall Street Journal.

speaker: EMILY
words: Very good progress. Rory dear, why don’t you save the rest of the paper till later hmm?

speaker: RORY
words: Ok. [to Grandpa] If I hug you, is it gonna hurt?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Pain is part of life. [she hugs him]
[Pan to Rory coming out of room and finds Luke sitting in the chairs beside the room]

speaker: EMILY
words: Well I finally found you some decent pillows, they’re not down but at least they give a little.

speaker: EMILY
words: Can you life your head at all?

speaker: RICHARD
words: There is a key in my top desk drawer.

speaker: RICHARD
words: All of our stock information is in there, plus all of the insurance information.

speaker: EMILY
words: Now if I could just find you some different sheets.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Our will is in my lower left drawer, Denis has a copy in case there’s a problem.

speaker: EMILY
words: Maybe I could get Dava to bring some from home -

speaker: RICHARD
words: Emily, this is serious. We have to be practical.

speaker: EMILY
words: I’m gonna have Dava get those -

speaker: RICHARD
words: Emily listen to me, if I die -

speaker: EMILY
words: Richard Gilmore, there may be many things happening in this hospital tonight but your dying is not one of them.

speaker: EMILY
words: No! I did not sign on to your dying. And it is not going to happen. Not tonight, not for a very long time. In fact, I demand to go first. Do I make myself clear?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yes Emily. You may go first.

speaker: EMILY
words: Good. I’m gonna get you those sheets. [picks up the phone as Richard takes her hand and holds it.]
[Pan to Lorelai and Rory by the coffee machine.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: I think I’m wearing it down.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, you have a visitor tonight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yeah. He pulled the old ‘tapping on the window’ bit.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Excuse me, I am never mean.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, there are only two things that I totally trust in this entire world. The fact that I will never be able to understand what Charo is saying no matter how long she lives in this country - and you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You just have to understand the major panic factor that went on there.

speaker: RORY
words: I do, I really do and I’m so sorry. Nothing like that will ever happen again. I swear.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because you are your mother’s daughter.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It means things can happen, even when you don’t really mean for them to happen.

speaker: RORY
words: I hated going to that party tonight without you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I hated you going to that party tonight without me. How were the apple tarts?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, Grandma didn’t make them this year.

speaker: EMILY
words: If you don’t mind, I think I need to just -

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh sure. Sit, please. How is he?

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh you know he’s - I don’t know. [playing with Grandpa’s tie]

speaker: EMILY
words: It was bothering him tonight. I told him not to loosen it. I wanted him to look nice for our guests, so he didn’t. And then well...The paramedics took it off him on the way here. I just haven’t been able to put it down yet [sniffles] I must sound crazy.

speaker: LUKE
words: I’ve kept my father’s entire store just the way he left it.

speaker: LUKE
words: Well I turned it into a diner, but I kept all his stuff on the walls, his pictures in the office, even the ‘Hardware’ sign.

speaker: EMILY
words: I’m sure he would’ve appreciated having his life’s worked being honored like that.

speaker: LUKE
words: He would’ve called me a damn fool.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh, well. I don’t know what Lorelai’s told you about her father, I can certainly imagine, but he’s a very good man. He always did the right thing for his family.

speaker: EMILY
words: So what exactly is going on between the two of you?

speaker: LUKE
words: Nothing. Really. We’re friends, that’s it.

speaker: EMILY
words: You’re idiots, the both of you.

speaker: EMILY
words: There you are, where have you been?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Coffee hunt. So what’s going on?

speaker: LUKE
words: Your mother called me an idiot.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow, you must have sucked up good.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well I’m going to go wash my face [leaves taking Rory with her.]
[Lorelai stands in front of the door to Grandpa’s room.]
[Lorelai looks at Grandpa who opens his eyes. They look at each other for a couple of seconds and are about to say something when the doctor, Rory and Grandma walk into the room.]

speaker: EMILY
words: ...I’ve heard for such a long time. Richard, how are you darling?

speaker: JOSHUA
words: Well Richard, it looks like we’re gonna be stuck with you for a while longer. It was just a touch of angina.

speaker: EMILY
words: But you have to watch your diet.

speaker: JOSHUA
words: Yes, that’s going to be very important. No more red meat, heavy desserts and you’re going to have to exercise regularly.

speaker: JOSHUA
words: We’d like to keep him over night though, just to be sure.

speaker: JOSHUA
words: As long as he does what he’s told, yes. [Lorelai sneaks out]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, yeah. They’re going to keep him over night but - but he’s going to be fine. [cries]

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey. [Luke hugs her] Ok, see here’s where the guy is supposed to give the girl his handkerchief but I don’t have one...and plus I find the practice a little revolting so...

speaker: LUKE
words: Alright. Oh hey, I got this for you.

speaker: LUKE
words: What? You’re not the only one who can flirt [Lorelai laughs] The door was open.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m gonna stick around here for a while and make sure everything’s are settled you know. You take her and I’ll drive the jeep back.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, yeah. I think it was those financial papers that really did the trick. [they giggle] So, um, Luke’s gonna take you home ok, I’m gonna hang out here for a while.

speaker: LUKE
words: No, go, call Dean. Talk mushy to each other and then spend an hour arguing over who’s going to hang up first.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok, well tell him good bye for me. And tell Grandpa I’ll come back tomorrow.

speaker: LUKE
words: Ok, walk fast and look straight ahead.
[Grandma and Joshua come out, Joshua leaves]

speaker: LORELAI
words: I sent her home with Luke.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I thought I’d stick around in case anybody needed anything.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I mean not you. You obviously don’t need anything, but somebody somewhere in this hospital might at some point need something and I’m gonna be the person who gets it for them.

speaker: EMILY
words: Would you like to go down to the cafeteria for something to eat?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes. Maybe somebody in the cafeteria will need something.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And won’t they feel lucky when they see me. ‘Hey I needed something and there you were’, it’s going to be a great moment.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Better, though he says that life is not life unless it includes a steak. How come you’re not out with everybody?

speaker: LUKE
words: I had some things to do.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right, anyways, this is for you. [giving him a bag]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do we really have to do this again? [he opens the present. It’s a baseball hat] I just thought, you know, God forbid something happens to that one, you might need a spare. Here [put it on forwards] Does that look wrong. [puts in on backwards] There! Oh hey turn out the lights [going to the window]

speaker: LUKE
words: For what? It’s not the real procession, it’s just the rehearsal.

speaker: LUKE
words: And why do they need to rehearse it? It’s the same thing every year.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Come on Luke, please. [he turns out the lights and joins her by the window] It’s hard to imagine living somewhere else isn’t it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’re welcome. Looks good on you.
(Lorelai and Rory are walking down the street)

speaker: RORY
words: Are we going to have to go through this every time we decide who cleans out the refrigerator?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you want to go back to thumb wrestling?

speaker: RORY
words: That's not a disease. Oh boy. (runs after her)

speaker: LORELAI
words: (to all the puppies) Hi! Oh hi! Hi! Oohh! Rory look at the baby! (in front of one)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aw, Buttercup was found cold and wet hovering under a hydrangea bush along highway 26. It's a sad highway.

speaker: RORY
words: As compare to all the other happy highways she could've been abandoned by.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Her lineage includes cocker spaniel, golden retriever, bouvier des flandres -

speaker: RORY
words: Buttercup is a special dog. She's extremely skiddish and tends to react badly towards blonde haired females, brunette males, children of either sex, other animals, red clothing, cabbage or anyone in a uniform.

speaker: LORELAI
words: (to Luke) Hey, we just found the doggy version of you.

speaker: LUKE
words: Do not let these two anywhere near a dog. They can barely feed themselves.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Shut up you! We'd be excellent pet owners, thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We could get him a pretty bowl...

speaker: LORELAI
words: ..cause this 'Buttercup' thing really has got to go.

speaker: RORY
words: Do I need to remind you of Skippy?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I can't believe you would bring up Skippy.

speaker: RORY
words: Every time mom would put her hand in his cage, he'd bit her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh this one laughed - trust me.

speaker: RORY
words: So finally she got fed up.

speaker: LUKE
words: Of being laughed at by a hamster?

speaker: RORY
words: So she stopped cleaning it's cage. Instead everyday she would stuff some Kleenex in there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It was the quilted kind (with a small smile)

speaker: RORY
