words: Or bipolar. That's very big nowadays.
(Miss Patty and Taylor are arguing at a table behind Lorelai.)

speaker: TAYLORORY
words: No, no, Patty, you're wrong. They built the fire to throw themselves on it when their families found them

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Taylor you're crazy! They built the fire so that they could stay warm their first night here.

speaker: TAYLORORY
words: Patty, I am the recording secretary for the Stars Hollow City Council, I think I know how my town was founded!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh, can nobody talk about anything else but this stupid festival? [pause] That came out a lot louder then it was supposed to, didn't it?

speaker: TAYLORORY
words: This festival is commemorating the founding of our town, young lady.

speaker: LUKE
words: Uh, can I get you two anything else?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know what is wrong with me. This is a beautiful festival. People should be enjoying it.

speaker: LUKE
words: It's a crazy festival based on a nutty myth about two lunatics, who in all probability did not even exist. And even if they did, probably dropped dead of diphtheria before age 24. The town of Stars Hollow probably got its name from the local dance hall prostitute. Two rich drunk guys who made up the story to make it look good on a poster.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You are full of hate and loathing, and I gotta tell you, I love it!

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, it's so good to have somebody share this hate with.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah please. Hey, tomorrow, if you have time, I'm planning on despising everyone who says 'Hey, how's it going?'

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, now that's just too easy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rachel? Your Rachel? [Turning to Rachel] You're Rachel?

speaker: LUKE
words: What are you…I mean, I thought you were in the Congo or Philadelphia or something.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Actually, though very similar to both the Congo and Philadelphia, I was in the Mideast.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh. Guess that postcard must've gotten lost.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Yeah, yeah, well things pretty crazy over there, not a lot of writing time. But I finished up my assignment, and I flew back to Chicago and I was walking through O'Hare, and I look up and there's a plane leaving for Hartford in like 20 minutes, and all of a sudden, I'm on it.

speaker: LUKE
words: Thanks. You um, you look, you, you uh look…

speaker: LORELAI
words: He thinks you look good too. Right?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah. She uh, uh, works at the Independence Inn.

speaker: RACHEL
words: That must be a pretty big job.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It is! It's crazy. There's always something happening. Like, we just put these coffee makers in all the rooms, but only half of them work. They just like shake and gurgle, like they're having some kind of a fit. Why were you in the Mideast?

speaker: RACHEL
words: I was doing a photo story, on how Palestinian and Israeli families have been affected by the violence.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh huh, well, so you understand about the job pressure.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Please, don't let me drive you away.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's okay, you're not. I have to go sit in a closet or something. So, it was really nice to meet you.
(Lorelai is combing Rory's hair in Rory's bedroom.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: 'Oh, we got new coffee makers.' Ugh! What was I thinking?

speaker: RORY
words: Well, you spent a lot of time picking out those coffee makers.

speaker: RORY
words: Ow! Okay, I'm still attached to the head.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, sorry. I'm a little worked up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know. I just hate that I made myself look so stupid in front of…

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, Rachel. She was standing there, fresh off a plane, and she had no plane hair at all might I add.

speaker: RORY
words: And what exactly is plane hair?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know, it's all big and all…bah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And he's staring at her like she's Miss September and she's looking at him like he's Johnny Depp, and I was just babbling like a moron, what is wrong with me?!

speaker: RORY
words: Ow! Ow! Okay, you are now officially off hair duty.

speaker: RORY
words: No, it's okay. I just think it's a little early for Dean to see me completely bald.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right, that's more a six-month thing.

speaker: RORY
words: So what's going on with you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know. It's just all this love in the air, you know. I miss Max. There's just been so much going on with your Dad coming home and family stuff and your constant existence…

speaker: LORELAI
words: Any time. So I haven't had a lot of time to focus on it and I miss Max.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I had a dream about him the other night.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, absolutely not. And when you're 21, I'll tell you the real answer. Anyway, it's put me in a funk since then.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Me too. We could talk about me for years, and believe me, we will. But let's focus on you, the lady of the evening. No hooker reference intended.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Now, what are you gonna wear with that?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, where is he taking you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, you don't want to clash with the decor. A lady plans ahead.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, if you must know, he's taking me to Andoloro's.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow, it's gonna be just like Lady and the Tramp. You'll share a plate of spaghetti, but it'll just be one long strand, but you won't realize it until you accidentally meet in the middle. And then, he'll push a meatball towards you with his nose, and you'll push it back with your nose, and then you'll bring the meatball home and you'll save it in the refrigerator for years and. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, neither. Just wear your coat.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But your flower's just a little smushed.

speaker: LORELAI
words: There you go, you're all set.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yeah, you look beautiful. Go.

speaker: LANE
words: I mean, three months, that's like one sixty-fourth of your life!

speaker: LANE
words: I have to stop hanging out with you. I mean, you're just making my life seem too pathetic.

speaker: RORY
words: Are you going to the festival? 'Cause maybe we could meet you there later.

speaker: LANE
words: Oh yeah, that would be romantic.

speaker: LANE
words: Yes, I'm going to the festival. And would you like to know why?

speaker: LANE
words: My mother has once again set me up.

speaker: LANE
words: A future chiropractor. I think she's losing confidence in my prospects.

speaker: LANE
words: Oh, it's not just him. We're going with his parents, his grandparents, two sisters, three brothers and at least one maiden aunt.

speaker: LANE
words: Remember, you have to tell me everything.

speaker: LANE
words: Oh yeah. After the walking, the silence, the sitting and the 'buh bye', that's when the fun will begin.

speaker: RORY
words: I wanna know anyhow. Bye Mom.

speaker: LANE
words: So, think I can hang out with you for awhile?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, uh, not unless you wanna go to Hartford. Besides didn't anyone ever tell you, it's not polite to keep fifteen prospective Korean in-laws waiting.

speaker: LANE
words: You can run over me on your way out. Maybe my mother wouldn't make me go if I was in the hospital.
(Lorelai is on the front porch finishing her coffee. Emily opens the door before Lorelai rings the doorbell.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Answer the door before I even rang the bell.

speaker: EMILY
words: I thought I heard something, I came to the door, you were there. Come in please. (Lorelai walks in.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, that door is like ten feet thick.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, so, it wasn't like I was standing out there with a band of jackals, I was just drinking coffee.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, what is it that you want to hear? That I was standing by the window, staring out at the driveway, waiting to pounce the moment you arrived.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, because believe it or not, that would be less creepy.
(Lorelai walks into living room. Richard is on the couch reading the newspaper.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sorry I'm late. I was helping Rory get ready for her big date, and well, you know girls.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah? Good, good. My work's fine too.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh God. Mom has gone a little crazy with the figurines here, huh? A little Kathy Bates. Although you probably haven't seen Misery, which is a good thing because Rory couldn't sleep alone for a week after we watched it. That wouldn't be a problem for you because you don't sleep alone anyway. I'm guessing. I don't know what your and mom's sleeping arrangement is. Now I'm wishing I hadn't brought it up because it's such a 'Wow, don't wanna go there' kind of a subject. For me, not for you, because you should definitely go there if you…uh, well anyway. Agh!

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, what have you done now?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nothing. I just, well, I'm putting the bunny back with his little friends and I just sort of massacred them a little bit, but that's life in the jungle isn't it?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Just sit with your hands in your lap.

speaker: RICHARD
words: And I'm trying to read, so just be quiet and try not to break anything else

speaker: EMILY
words: So are we having a nice chat?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, we're having a great conversation, me and Morrie.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nothing. Thanks, Mom, for letting Rory out of dinner tonight. She really appreciated it.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, she deserves to celebrate. A three-month anniversary is a landmark feat at her age. Or at any age for some people.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I was gonna get a drink. I'm gonna get right on that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Can I freshen up your drink Dad?

speaker: RICHARD
words: No, thank you. One drink before dinner is quite enough.
(Emily returns to the room with a man.)

speaker: EMILY
words: I had no idea it was so close!

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, what a small world. Oh, Lorelai, I'd like you to meet Chase Bradford.

speaker: EMILY
words: He was just telling me that he actually grew up right around the corner from here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, the one with the Dobermans.

speaker: CHASE
words: That's right. Leopold and Loeb. Though I'm afraid they passed on quite a few years ago.

speaker: EMILY
words: Uh, Chase, this is my husband, Richard.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Emily, I didn't know we were having company for dinner.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh well, it was just sort of a spur of the moment thing. Chase's mother and I are in the DAR together and he just moved back to Hatrford, and it just seemed like a nice idea.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Uh Chase, can I get you a drink?

speaker: CHASE
words: Fine. So Lorelai, your mother's told me all about you.

speaker: CHASE
words: Oh yes. I'm just sorry your daughter couldn't join us for dinner. I adore children.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, can I talk to you for a minute?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It'll just take a second, really.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Come on, it'll be fun. Excuse us. We're just gonna have a spur of the moment conversation. (Lorelai guides Emily out of the room.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, Connecticut Ken in there, is he my invited escort for the evening?

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, his mother is a friend of mine.

speaker: EMILY
words: He just moved back here and doesn't know anyone.

speaker: EMILY
words: And I thought he might enjoy meeting you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, this is why the Miss Congeniality act when Rory wanted to beg out of dinner.

speaker: EMILY
words: It just seemed like a good opportunity.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, thank you for the thought, but I can get my own men.

speaker: EMILY
words: Chase is a quality man, he has good breeding, he comes from a nice family. He makes a nice living, he's attractive.

speaker: EMILY
words: Is it gonna kill you to simply keep an open mind about him?

speaker: EMILY
words: Why not? Because I like him?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know, I swear, I don't know which one, but there is a game show out there with your name on it.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well that must be it because you've hardly said two words to the man. You couldn't possibly hate him already.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh no, it's that arcade game where the mole keeps sticking his head out and you have to pound him as many times as you can with the mallet. You would be a master at that game.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, I realize that Chase may not be as controversial as your usual brand of men.

speaker: LORELAI
words: They would erect a statue of you next to it with perfect hair and pearls and a big bronze mallet.

speaker: EMILY
words: But I want you to think about something. Tonight your daughter is celebrating her three-month anniversary. What was the last relationship you had that lasted that long? [pause] I thought so.
(Lorelai and Emily return to living room.)

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, here we are. I'm very sorry.

speaker: CHASE
words: Oh, that's all right. I had a chance to tell Richard a little bit about what I do in the actuarial business.

speaker: CHASE
words: Lorelai, may I fix you something to drink?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What about the one drink before dinner rule?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, we have guests. We're celebrating. Chase, here, let me help you with that.

speaker: DEAN
words: What about that cheese bread thing? Too heavy?

speaker: RORY
words: Everything was perfect. Even the soda was good. I don't know how they do it but the Coke here is definitely superior to the Coke anywhere else.

speaker: DEAN
words: Okay, at what point during that did you start making fun of me?

speaker: RORY
words: I would never make fun of you. Especially not after you ordered three different kinds of pasta for me just because I couldn't decide.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well you shouldn't have to decide. I mean, tonight, you should have everything that you want.

speaker: RORY
words: I just have to say that I'm now a very big fan of the three-month anniversary.

speaker: RORY
words: Definitely. I think they should have T-shirts and newsletters.

speaker: RORY
words: You did all this for me.

speaker: RORY
words: This is just like that Christmas when I got a full set of illustrated encyclopedias. [Dean gives a confused look] I wanted them.

speaker: WAITERORY
words: One tiramisu, two forks, and uh, one meatball to go.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you. [takes a bite] Okay, have I mentioned how much I'm loving the three month anniversary thing?

speaker: RORY
words: Because this tiramisu is so good that if the anniversary were completely sucking right now, this would save it. What?

speaker: RORY
words: I do not eat cute. No one eats cute. Bambi maybe, but he's a cartoon.

speaker: DEAN
words: So, uh, after we finish here we move onto phase two of the anniversary evening.

speaker: RORY
words: Phase 2. Sounds very official, are there space suits involved?
(Lorelai, Emily, Richard and Chase are eating dinner.)

speaker: CHASE
words: So Lorelai, are you a member of the DAR?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I'm not. D-A-R-N. [giggles] See, uh, that's like darn 'cause it was a play on DAR. Boy, these carrots sure are tiny.

speaker: EMILY
words: Chase, I'm simply fascinated about your work situation. Tell us how you wound up back here at home. I mean, you move away to make your fortune and you end up right back here. Isn't life funny?

speaker: RICHARD
words: It's a comedy for the masses.

speaker: CHASE
words: Well I worked hard and the company was very good to me. You know a thing or two about company loyalty I assume, Richard. Well, the company offered me a choice of East Coast locations, sort of a big vote of confidence in the job I was doing. Picking your locale, it's a very coveted position to be in.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, would like to be picking my locale right now.

speaker: CHASE
words: So I sat down and made my wish list. I looked for places that offered location amenities as well as job growth, and finally after days of research, checking into traffic conditions, crime rates, the best school systems, my decision came down to just two places. One was in New York, one was in Hartford.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Emily, is there any more roast?

speaker: CHASE
words: Hartford has all the cosmopolitan big city benefits that New York has, without actually having to live in New York. It just seemed like a no brainer.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'll get dad some more roast.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, but it's so much more personal this way.

speaker: CHASE
words: Hurry back. I just simply have to know what the allure of this Stars Hollow is I've heard so much about.
(Rory and Dean walk to the festival)

speaker: DEAN
words: So, what book did you bring?

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, come on, you always bring a book with you and I was just wondering, what's the three month anniversary book?

speaker: RORY
words: Actually, I brought the New Yorker.
(From the gazebo, the mayor starts the festivities)

speaker: MAYORORY
words: People of Stars Hollow, and our many friends. It gives me great pleasure to preside over our annual founders festival for the thirty-second time. Many a true love has had it start right on the spot where I stand. And I don't mind telling you that at this very festival, right by this gazebo, is where I met my own true love, Miss Dora Braythwait. We have been married for 43 years, and it all started right here.

speaker: TAYLORORY
words: (covers microphone and whispers) Ask her to wave.

speaker: MAYORORY
words: (To Taylor) She went to Bingo in Bridgeport. (To crowd) And now my friends, if you will join me in lighting the fire.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, take me to the surprise now.

speaker: DEAN
words: But I thought you said you wanted to see the bonfire being lit.

speaker: DEAN
words: Wait, but Mayor Porter just said. . .

speaker: RORY
words: Trust me. It's gonna be awhile before it's lit. We'll have plenty of time before they're ready.

speaker: AYORORY
words: Oh for Pete's sake. Does anyone have any matches?
(Lorelai, Emily, Richard, and Chase at dinner table.)

speaker: EMILY
words: It sounds it. Tell us more.

speaker: CHASE
words: Well, we're in the middle of building new statistical models that let us do a better job at predicting death than we've ever been able to do before. Richard, you might find this interesting.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, I've never been one for sitting at a computer building models, Chase. I'm a client contact man myself.

speaker: CHASE
words: But these models give you a better product to sell to those clients.

speaker: CHASE
words: Oh it is. In fact, if you were to answer a few simple questions for me, I could practically pinpoint the day you're going to die.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Go ahead. Ask her the questions.

speaker: CHASE
words: No no, Lorelai! I'd have to feed the information into a computer to get the answer. I'm no Kreskin!

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, Chase, why don't you and Lorelai retire to the living room for some Brandy while I help Leta clean up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, sure. I'm just going to, um, go and powder my something. But I'll be back in a minute and I'll meet you in the living room.
(Lorelai walks into her old bedroom, grabs her coat off the bed, and starts to climb out the window when Richard walks in.)

speaker: RICHARD
words: Lorelai, your mother wants to know if. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi daddy. Okay, I know this is bad. And I know this probably brings back all the horrible aspects of my childhood life for you. And see, I'm really sorry that we fought last week, and I'm really sorry that you're so disappointed in me, and I really wish there was something I can do to fix that, but there probably isn't and I can accept that because I am an adult now and I am proud of who I have become. But I am begging you, please, please do not make me go back down there because that guy is boring.
(Rory and Dean are standing in front of a fenced-in junkyard)

speaker: DEAN
words: Okay. Uh, did you ever see Christine?

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, it's nothing like that. Come on.
(They go through an opening in the fence)

speaker: RORY
words: Ah. And yet it looks so much like Beirut.

speaker: RORY
words: What do you mean it's mine?

speaker: DEAN
words: I mean, I'm building it piece by piece for you.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah. I started with the frame. The seats and the windshield just went in yesterday.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah, now it's gonna take awhile, but when I'm done, it'll be great.

speaker: RORY
words: You're building me a car. You're building me a car.

speaker: RORY
words: This is crazy. Why would you do this?

speaker: DEAN
words: I don't know. You didn't have one.

speaker: DEAN
words: What? I didn't want you wasting time on the bus anymore. I mean, that is very valuable time we could be arguing about your ongoing obsession with very confusing Russian authors.

speaker: RORY
words: Do I like it? Are you kidding? (she kisses him)

speaker: DEAN
words: I'll take that as a yes.
(Dean tries to open the door for her, but it falls off the car.)

speaker: RORY
words: Don't. I like it like that. (they both get in the car) This is amazing.

speaker: RORY
words: I had no idea that three months was the car anniversary.

speaker: DEAN
words: Four months you get a plane.

speaker: RORY
words: Boy, relationships sure have changed since I was a kid. (they lean back and look at the stars) I'm having one of those moments right now.

speaker: RORY
words: One of those moments that everything is so perfect and so wonderful that you almost feel sad because nothing can ever be this good again.

speaker: RORY
words: No. I just. . . I'm surprised, I didn't expect. . .I don't. . .

speaker: RORY
words: No, I just have to think about it for a minute.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, saying I love you is a really difficult thing.

speaker: RORY
words: And you did it really well.

speaker: DEAN
words: What the hell does that mean?

speaker: RORY
words: I'm sorry. Please. This totally came as a surprise. I mean, with the dinner, and the car, and then the… I just need a minute to think

speaker: DEAN
words: This is not something that you think about Rory. This is either something that you feel or you don't.

speaker: DEAN
words: Why? Because I say I love you and you wanna think about it? I mean, go home and discuss it with your mother? Make one of your pro/con lists?

speaker: DEAN
words: I'm sorry. I'm an idiot. I don't even know what I was thinking.

speaker: RORY
words: Dean. Please, it's just not that easy for me. I mean, saying I love you means a lot. Think about it from my point of view. I mean, my mom and our life. I mean, my mom said that she loved my dad and then. . .

speaker: DEAN
words: You don't get pregnant saying I love you.

speaker: RORY
words: I know. I'm just confused. I need to…It's a really big deal.

speaker: RORY
words: Dean, tonight was amazing. It was perfect. Please, I swear, I just need a minute to. . .

speaker: DEAN
words: Whatever, it doesn't matter, all right? Let's go.

speaker: JACKSON
words: You know what I'm thinking about right now?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: That time I roasted some red peppers over the stove burner and singed off my eyebrows?

speaker: JACKSON
words: I'm just thinking, this is really nice.
(Rachel takes some pictures, then walks over to a bench and sits down next to Luke.)

speaker: RACHEL
words: Oh yeah, yeah, the firelight really changes people. Ya know, makes them seem happier, freer, all troubles of the world completely gone.

speaker: LUKE
words: I don't think that's the firelight. I think it's the Founders Day party punch they've been selling.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Oh yeah, that stuff is good

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay, at some point, are you gonna tell me what you're doing here?

speaker: RACHEL
words: I'm putting more film in my camera.

speaker: RACHEL
words: What? I told you, I was at the airport, now I'm here.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh well sure, when you put it like that.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Correct me if I'm wrong, but you don't sound all that happy to see me.

speaker: LUKE
words: Correct me if I'm wrong, but you have a tendency to show up and then leave, quite suddenly. One of your more charming attributes.

speaker: RACHEL
words: So you're not happy to see me? Luke, I don't know what I'm doing here. I just missed you. I wanted to see you. I don't know what else to say.

speaker: RACHEL
words: So since we're both being blunt, what's the deal with Lorelai?

speaker: RACHERORY
words: I'm talking about Lorelai, the lady who runs the inn, the one you've told me absolutely nothing about, and been very careful to leave out of every story, anecdote, or gossip about the town.

speaker: LUKE
words: There is no deal with Lorelai. We're friends.

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, Lorelai is, she's just uh…I don't know. I mean, at time it seems like, I don't know. But I am happy to see you.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Good. I'm gonna get some of that party punch. You want some?

speaker: RACHEL
words: Oh Luke, some things never change.
(Rachel walks away. After a few seconds, Lorelai sits down next to Luke.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey. Where the hell's the fire department when you need them?

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey, aren't you supposed to be in Hartford?

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's it. You're not curious why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's what I love about you.

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey, how long you been here?

speaker: LUKE
words: Did you see Harry and Taylor get into a fist fight?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No! Aww! How did I miss that? I'm so bummed!

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, she's a founder's party punch junkie.

speaker: LORELAI
words: God, even the nice girls aren't safe.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah. She's been running around here taking all kinds of pictures.

speaker: LUKE
words: I guess so. I hope so.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, what's the haps with you two?

speaker: LUKE
words: The haps? Well, lets see. What is the haps?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I mean, like, ya know, what's going. . .

speaker: LUKE
words: I know what you meant by the haps.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, well you're repeating it like a thousand times.

speaker: LUKE
words: If I did it fast it wouldn't be pondering. Pondering by nature is a slow connotation.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She seems to really like you.

speaker: LUKE

words: I don't know. You spend a lot of time debating things, ya know, is it right, is it wrong, or should I do this, should I do that. I mean, sometimes you should just jump in and take a shot. What's the worst that can happen? She left before, I lived. Maybe this time.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That you have somebody you can go check up on. That's nice.

speaker: LUKE

(Lorelai walks in, picks up phone, dials, sits on the couch.)

(Rory walks in. Lorelai hangs up the phone.)
(Lorelai walks to Rory and hugs her.)

speaker: RORY
words: We broke up, we just broke up.

speaker: RORY
words: We - we went to dinner and then we walked by the bonfire but it wasn’t lit so we went to this junkyard and we sat in this car and then - oh God!

speaker: RORY
words: Oh I can’t believe I left your meatball in the car.

words: Ok, ok, come on [as they sit on the couch]

speaker: RORY
words: After I told the waiter to wrap it up and everything. And everyone was like ‘what do you want with one meatball?’ And I was like ‘It’s a mother/daughter thing.’ And I’m sure he thought I was nuts but he was so nice and he did it anyway and he uh, he brought one of those tin foil swans or duck or some kind of bird and - and then I left it in the car.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, forget about the meatball ok? Just tell me what happened.

words: So I can help decipher what happened here.

speaker: LORELAI

speaker: LORELAI

words: Because I have read every Nancy Drew mystery ever written. The one about the Amish country, twice. I know there’s more to the story than what you’re telling me. What are you doing?

words: Nothing, I just want to get started. I made a list of all the things we say we’re going to do on the weekend but then when the weekend comes around you say they’re too boring to actually do one a weekend day, so then you say we’ll do them during the week, which of course we never do. So I think that we should get them all out of the way today once and for all. And to make it interesting, we should come up with like a reward system so once we’re done with everything on the list we could go get manicures or we could go to the Swiss place for fondue for dinner or we could stuff our purses full of sour patch kids and milk duds and go see the Stars Hollow elementary school production of ‘Who’s afraid of Virginia Woolfe.’

words: Oh yeah, get back in your pajamas, go to bed, eat nothing but gallons of ice cream and tons of pizza, don’t take a shower or shave your legs or put on any kind of make up at all and just sit in the dark and watch a really sad movie and have a good long cry and just wallow. You need to wallow.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, your first love is intense and your first break up even more intense. Shoving it away and ignoring it while you make lists it’s not gonna help.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, Rory and Dean broke up and um, she won’t wallow. And I told her that she should wallow you know because that’s supposed to help you get through the pain and then you can accept it and then you can get over somebody and you can move on with your life. And then she asked me how long it was before I got over you and I didn’t know what to say you know because I can’t lie to her, and I realized that if I gave her any time frame at all I would be lying because I’m not over you and I don’t know how long it will be before I am. And who am I to be teaching her about healing and moving on and breakups any how. I mean I might as well be teaching her how to eat fire or swallow a sword or put her legs behind her head you know, because at least that’s a trade. I mean the first two are, I don’t know about putting the legs um, behind your head, but the point is that I’m an idiot and I’m a hypocrite and I really miss you.

speaker: PARIS
words: I think that the basic structure of the Elizabethan government is relatively sound. The division of power between the monarchy, the privy council and the parliament all seem to work. Agreed?

speaker: PARIS
words: Ok, so in establishing our own government, I think duplicating a similar structure would be good, with a few alterations. Queen Elizabeth chose to remain unwed. She took on the burden of leadership all by herself at a time when possibly marrying the Prince of France or the King of Spain would solidify her thrown while expanding her empire. And though it obviously worked for her, and the concept of a woman ruling without man is certainly politically correct these days, I think we need to take a different tact. [in the background while Louise and Madeline talk] I think we need to devise a nation with a truly solidified royal alliance...

speaker: RORY
words: Meaning next time maybe you should pick a girl with a little more substance. You know, a girl who’s smart and is driven and has ambition. You know like Paris.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah why not? Paris is smart and cute and interesting and yes she does bring her own unique set of baggage into the mix.

speaker: RORY
words: But she likes you. She’s crazy about you. She thinks you’re amazing.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: You want me to date Paris?

speaker: RORY
words: Louis, I think this is the beginning of a wonderful friendship.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well it’s Friday night and traffic’s bad on Friday night.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Since the beginning of time. Here let me do that. [puts on necklace for Rory]

speaker: RORY
words: You’ve been ready and bugging me for almost an hour. Usually I have to drag you out of here kicking and screaming to go to dinner.

speaker: RORY
words: You whine, you complain, you act like a child.

speaker: RORY
words: I had to pay you five bucks once so you wouldn’t go in sweats.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Make your point and make it fast, as we move quickly to the front door.

speaker: RORY
words: My point is that you are mean.

speaker: RORY
words: You are. You want to go to dinner to see Grandma uncomfortable, that’s mean.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, ok, look. I will admit, I work very hard and sometimes I am a little tired come Friday night for the Gilmore family dinner. But I had a light day today and my grandmother who I have not seen for years is going to be there.

speaker: RORY
words: And it has nothing to do with the fact that Grandma hates Great-grandma?

speaker: RORY
words: And when you see Grandma miserable and uncomfortable you’re going to be sad and sympathetic?

speaker: RORY
words: I want you to be nice.

speaker: RORY
words: And no outward reveling in someone else’s pain.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok good. Oh wait [grabs a camera] So the internal reveling can continue for years to come.
[Lorelai and Rory are carrying the hat rack]

speaker: RORY
words: God, this thing weighs like a 1000 pounds.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know, I know. Here, put down.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, in case Gran comes to the door you know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I mean she’s 80. The eyes have got to be gone right?

speaker: RORY
words: Let’s just try to keep her inside the house.

speaker: EMILY
words: Hurry up, bring it in here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok mom, thanks for the direction and all but, um, we need some help.

speaker: EMILY
words: Watch it, watch your head. Get it over here. Ok yes, yeah I think that was about - no I think it was maybe a little more on the left. Oh God I should have put tape down.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, you don’t think that the coat rack could’ve moved a quarter of an inch in five years?

speaker: EMILY
words: Yeah you’re right. That’s it. Ok, put your coats on it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How’d you get her in here without her noticing it wasn’t there?

speaker: EMILY
words: Well I brought her in through the back way then I had Stella wax the floors, also she napped so that took up about an hour.

speaker: EMILY
words: In the living room scratching the diamond pendant I bought her against a mirror.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So we shouldn’t keep her waiting huh?

speaker: EMILY
words: No you’re right, we shouldn’t. Oh, heaven help me! [they head for the living room. Lorelai chuckles.]

speaker: TRIX
words: If I wanted to look, I would look. I haven’t looked therefore you must draw your own conclusions. Ah, thank you, dear boy. [Grandpa gives her a drink]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, it’s so good to see you again.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Trix, this is Rory. You haven’t met her yet.

speaker: TRIX
words: No, I don’t believe I have.

speaker: TRIX
words: Come. I want to get a very good look at both of you. They’re tall.

speaker: TRIX
words: Good. That means that the majority of your blood is Gilmore blood. Gilmore’s don’t get sick. Am I right Richard?

speaker: TRIX
words: That’s right. Your mother is always sick.

speaker: TRIX
words: Gilmore’s don’t have headaches, our heads are perfect. You don’t drink?

speaker: TRIX
words: Emily, get this woman a drink.

speaker: EMILY
words: I’m going to go get the hors d’ouevres.

speaker: TRIX
words: My son speaks of you constantly. He seems very fond of you.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh well I’m very fond of him too.

speaker: RICHARD
words: This little girl is as smart as a whip Mom. I think she has a great deal of you in her.

speaker: TRIX
words: How nice. [Grandma enters with a tray of cheese] Is this cheese?

speaker: TRIX
words: Am I supposed to eat that cheese?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Emily, where are those spiced nuts that Trix likes so much?

speaker: TRIX
words: So Lorelai, since I’ve seen you last, you’ve grown up, gotten pregnant out of wedlock, raised a child and still haven’t bothered to get married. Have I left anything out?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well sometime in between growing up and getting pregnant, I got my ears pierced.

speaker: TRIX
words: I’ve always hated a scandal. However I’ve always appreciated self-sufficiency. Tell me, how do you support this child?

speaker: TRIX
words: Good. Hard work is good for a woman - makes her stronger. I admire people who enjoy hard work.

speaker: TRIX
words: Thank you Emily. I suppose I can just put these nuts in my hand.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So Gran, um, when was the last time I saw you?

speaker: TRIX
words: You were still in your teens, wild hair flying everywhere. I see you’ve taken care of that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, I joined a support group, bought a hair brush and just taking it one day at a time.

speaker: TRIX
words: Good for you. Richard, I would like to be escorted into the dining room now.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, uh, I’m not sure that dinner is ready just yet.

speaker: EMILY
words: But it’s only five after Mom.

speaker: TRIX
words: Only five after? Richard, in the even that I am kidnapped and a ransom is demanded at a certain time, I would prefer that Emily not be in charge of the drop off. [Lorelai and Rory get up and follow. Lorelai gives Emily a ‘what can you do’ shoulder shrug]

speaker: TRIX
words: Very good young lady, well all believe you. Now, let’s talk about your education. Where are you attending school?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Rory is in the top ten percent of her class.

speaker: EMILY
words: We’re very proud of our Rory. She’s going to Harvard.

speaker: TRIX
words: Richard, how can you allow this girl to go to Harvard?!

speaker: TRIX
words: You’re a Yale man, your father was a Yale man!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well we want Rory to be whatever kind of man she wants to be.

speaker: TRIX
words: That’s enough jokes for this evening Lorelai.

speaker: TRIX
words: Now if you don’t mind my asking, Chilton is rather an expensive institution, I’m curious how the manager of an inn can afford such a luxury?

speaker: EMILY
words: We’re helping Lorelai out a little.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yes, we’ve seen to it that Rory’s education is taken care of.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But it’s temporary. It’s a loan. I plan to pay them back every cent. They know this.

speaker: TRIX
words: That’s it, I’m done. Richard. Tomorrow, Rory, I shall plan the menu. When you’ve lived in Europe you learn a thing or two about food.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, I can’t. I’m studying tomorrow. I’m in a study group and our presentation is due on Monday

speaker: TRIX
words: Oh very well, your mother can tell you all about it.

speaker: TRIX
words: I once traveled to a small village in Cambodia, I did not eat dessert there either.
[Louise is laying across several desks with her eyes closed]

speaker: MADELINE
words: It’s almost nine. Hey maybe I’ll own a magazine some day. Then I’ll get all my nail polish for free.

speaker: LOUISE
words: I’m going back to sleep. Tell Paris I hate her.

speaker: PARIS
words: You’ll thank me when you get into Sarah Lawrence.

speaker: RORY
words: And doughnuts in the shape of clowns.

speaker: RORY
words: Well a clown just isn’t a clown without a hat. [to Paris] Here is your decaf with soy milk.

speaker: RORY
words: You’re welcome. So I read your doctrine and I thing our imaginary kingdom is off to a pretty good start.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah. I mean the taxes are a little high and the landowner’s power should be regulated a little more.

speaker: PARIS
words: It was a different time back then.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah but the fundamental human needs were the same.

speaker: PARIS
words: We’re supposed to set it up within -

speaker: LOUISE
words: Ding, ding, ding. No debating until I’ve had coffee.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Paris, can I talk to you for a sec?

speaker: LOUISE
words: And that is about what pray tell?

speaker: MADELINE
words: I don’t know. The project - maybe?

speaker: LOUISE
words: They could’ve talked project here. It’s something else. Something private.

speaker: LOUISE
words: All the taste, but much fewer calories.

speaker: RORY
words: Or we could wait for her to come back in to see if she wants us to know.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Those who simply wait for information to find them, spend a lot of time sitting by the phone. Those who go out and find it themselves, have something to say when it rings.

speaker: RORY
words: My next guess. [Paris comes back in.]

speaker: LOUISE
words: So, what was with the confab in the hallway?

speaker: MADELINE
words: Wow, this is amazing. God I’m jealous.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Details please. Don’t leave out anything. We want every comma, apostrophe and ampersand.

speaker: PARIS
words: Well he just asked me out.

speaker: LOUISE
words: He asked you out for tonight.

speaker: RORY
words: Or maybe he just got up the nerve to ask her out.

speaker: LOUISE
words: This is so amazing. I mean you are so far from Tristin’s type.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Tristin usually likes his girls bad.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Looks like we’re going to have to do the Pink Ladies makeover on you.

speaker: LOUISE
words: We’ll turn you from a sweet Sandy to a sluty Sandy. Dancing at the school fair with high heels, black spandex and permed hair.

speaker: MADELINE
words: You can borrow my water bra.

speaker: MADELINE
words: My water bra. It’s like a padded bra but it’s filled with some sort of liquid so it moves.

speaker: PARIS
words: Great. Thanks, but I’ll pass. Everyone come on, let’s get to work.

speaker: RORY
words: I think you’re gonna have a really good time.

speaker: PARIS
words: Yeah well, it’s just a date right?

speaker: RORY
words: Do you want one? [point at the clowns]

speaker: LORELAI
words: [running into the house and upstairs] Hi! Five minute talking break while I change. [upstairs] My day - big leak third floor, lots of things going squish that should not be squishing. Michel is not help. And now I’m late for dinner which by the way I’m completely bummed you’re not coming to - [holding up shirts] which one - blue, black, good, bad?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok. Are you sure you can’t come?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah I’m sure. If I’m not prepared tomorrow, Paris is gonna have me sent to the Tower. Although if things go well tonight, I bet it’ll help tomorrow.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, she’s going out on a date with Tristin.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [in Ricki Ricardo voice] Lucy, how many times have I told you not to butt into there people’s business?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Alright, well I want details tomorrow now how do I look?

speaker: LORELAI
words: [sighs] Ok. My five minutes are up. [grabbing shoes] Let’s go. [going downstairs] There is money on the kitchen table and there’s really good chocolate cake that I took out and defrosted for you specially this morning and call me if you need me and I’ll be home early and what else?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, yeah broken record. Ok, I’m gone.
[Pan to later, Rory studying and eating cake. Knock]

speaker: PARIS
words: [holding clothes] I don’t know what to wear.

speaker: PARIS
words: On my date with Tristin. I’m not trendy girl ok? I don’t haunt the boutiques hoping to find that one fabulous little top. I study and then I think about studying and then I study some more.

speaker: RORY
words: Do you want to come in?

speaker: PARIS
words: I only have one lipstick at home ok? And it’s barely even a color. You put it on and it looks like you’re not wearing anything which is why I liked it in the first place. But to date you need the fabulous little top and you need a lipstick that you can actually tell you’re wearing.

speaker: RORY
words: Do you want to put that stuff down?

speaker: PARIS
words: You said once that if I ever needed to talk to anymore I could come talk to you.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok, can I ask you a question?

speaker: RORY
words: Why didn’t you go to Madeline or Louise about this? I mean they seem to get that ‘fabulous little top’ thing.

speaker: PARIS
words: Oh yeah that they get. The whole supportive ‘You’re going to be fine and not throw up 12 times on the way to his car’ thing - that they don’t get.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok, let’s just see what you got.

speaker: PARIS
words: I brought everything just in case there was some sort of hidden potential in something that I just didn’t see. So?

speaker: RORY
words: Well you’d be one well dressed widow.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes you are. Come on now. This is your entire wardrobe?

speaker: PARIS
words: Nothing but my Chilton uniform and my bat mitzvah dress which has menorahs on the collar.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok let’s think. Come on. [going upstairs]

speaker: RORY
words: to our one stop shopping store.

speaker: PARIS
words: I can’t wear your mother’s clothes.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes you can, I do it all the time. What about this? [holding up pink blouse]

speaker: PARIS
words: My mother says the color pink makes my head look small.

speaker: PARIS
words: This whole thing is so insane.

speaker: PARIS
words: Tristin asking me out? Why would he do that?

speaker: RORY
words: Why would he not do that?

speaker: PARIS
words: Because he’s gorgeous and experienced and only dates those most likely to become a trophy wife.

speaker: RORY
words: Tristin would be lucky to go out with someone like you. He’s not going to have to read the menu to you or explain that the dancing trash bins in the movie theatre previews aren’t real. It’s going to be much less stressful.

speaker: PARIS
words: All these years I’ve hoped this would happen and now it has and I feel...I don’t know. I don’t have a lot of experience in the dating department. I mean if you can’t put it on your transcript what’s the point right?

speaker: RORY
words: I know. Before Dean I’d never had a boyfriend. Or a kiss.

speaker: RORY
words: I never even thought about dating.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah. And he was so special and nice and made me completely nauseous.

speaker: RORY
words: I couldn’t even talk around him.

speaker: PARIS
words: I saw you at the dance. You didn’t seem to have any trouble talking. Or gazing annoyingly into each others eyes.

speaker: RORY
words: But that was after we’d been dating a little. After we started going out and spending time together, I don’t know, it just kind of got easier. And then by the third date everything was perfect.

speaker: PARIS
words: Do you miss him a lot?

speaker: RORY
words: Thanks. But tonight is not about me. Tonight is about you going out with Tristin in this outfit. What do you think?

speaker: PARIS
words: It’s ok. [Rory gives her a look] It’s great.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah. Bathroom’s down the hall and I’ll get you a lipstick with some actual color in it.

speaker: PARIS
words: Ok. [throws her jacket on the bed and note cards fall out of it.]

speaker: RORY
words: Uh, Paris. What are these cards that fell out of your jacket?

speaker: PARIS
words: Oh yeah. Those are notes for tonight.

speaker: PARIS
words: Yeah. Just some reference points really - you know subjects to bring up in case the conversation lags.

speaker: RORY
words: Well can I suggest that you leave this one about the Spanish Inquisition out?

speaker: RORY
words: Well I don’t really trust your opinion on that subject so come out here please.

speaker: PARIS
words: Fine but it looks bad. [opens bathroom door]

speaker: RORY
words: Well then weird works for you because you look amazing.

speaker: PARIS
words: Really? You’re not just saying that?

speaker: PARIS
words: Because that affects the validity of your swearing to God.

speaker: RORY
words: You look great. And I wouldn’t tell you you did if you didn’t.

speaker: PARIS
words: Ok, well if you think it looks ok.

speaker: RORY
words: I believe the word ‘amazing’ was used.

speaker: PARIS
words: You’re going to hold this evening over my head for the rest of my life aren’t you?

speaker: TRIX
words: What did you think about the rabbit?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, I thought it was wonderful.

speaker: TRIX
words: You know I brought it with me.

speaker: TRIX
words: From London. London has the best game.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You brought it with you from London?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What, did you get it a seat?

speaker: TRIX
words: Well it looks like we’re finished here.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Let’s retire to the living room for a brandy.

speaker: TRIX
words: Yes. Lorelai, walk with me. I have something that I want to discuss with you.

speaker: TRIX
words: I’ve been thinking about something I heard the other night.

speaker: TRIX
words: That you borrowed money from your parents for Rory’s school.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well if you’re worried about them getting the money back -

speaker: TRIX
words: You know Shakespeare once wrote ‘Neither a borrower nor a lender be’. Do you consider Shakespeare a wise man?

speaker: EMILY
words: We certainly don’t mind loaning Lorelai the money if that’s what you’re worried about.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Certainly not. Rory is first priority in this house.

speaker: TRIX
words: I’m not concerned about whether you mind or not. Loaning money is a dirty business. It’s distasteful and I don’t care for it. As you know, I came into town to check up on the family investments and to talk with our lawyers. I have some things to put in order, and one of them is setting up a trust fund for Rory.

speaker: TRIX
words: Now normally I would set up a fund that she would have access to when she’s 25. However, considering the situation, if you like, I will arrange for her to get it now.

speaker: TRIX
words: That way she can use it to pay for Chilton.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh Gran, I don’t know what to say, that is so generous of you.

speaker: RICHARD
words: My mother is a very special woman isn’t she?

speaker: TRIX
words: You talk about me like I’m dead.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh you’re never going to die! You’re too stubborn!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Gran this is - I don’t know what to say.

speaker: TRIX
words: Nothing now would be preferable. I have arranged for you and your mother and I to have tea tomorrow before I leave. Say it then. Good night Emily.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well I’ll just uh, walk mother upstairs and be right back.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow! That was quite a bomb she just dropped.

speaker: LORELAI
words: God! Um, I guess I should be going. Thanks for dinner Mom. I’ll see you tomorrow. [leaves]

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai...[follows her to foyer] You’re not honestly considering accepting that money are you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um yeah, of course I’m considering it.

speaker: EMILY
words: I don’t think that’s very wise.

speaker: EMILY
words: Because she’s a young girl. She won’t know the first thing about managing that money.

speaker: EMILY
words: You don’t know the first thing about managing that money either.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, but I’ve very familiar with the second thing.

speaker: EMILY
words: How can you not see the pitfalls in accepting that money?

speaker: EMILY
words: I mean you’re the one that brags about how special your relationship with Rory is. I’m stunned that you want to jeopardize it like this.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well you know as well as I do that money is freedom.

speaker: EMILY
words: If Rory has that money she won’t need you anymore.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t know Mom, she’s 16. There’s still a couple of ways I might come in handy, you know buying the beer that kind of stuff.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well I’m glad you thing losing your daughter is so funny.

speaker: EMILY
words: She’ll be self sufficient, she won’t need you to pay for anything, she won’t have to turn to you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Everything in a relationship isn’t about money mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: She’ll move out as soon as she can.

speaker: EMILY
words: She won’t need your help to put her through college, she won’t need you to buy a car.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok you know what? Say goodbye to Dad for me as soon as the voices in your head subside.

speaker: EMILY
words: Why should she wait to backpack around Europe with you? She could afford to go herself. And she could take a friend or a boyfriend or anyone.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah well she wants to go with me.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well now of course she does she doesn’t have options. But the minute you give her options...

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, that’s it. You’re nuts and I’m going - in that order. [leaves]

speaker: EMILY
words: It’s terrible not to be needed. You’ll see!

[Pan to Gilmore house, Lorelai walks in and goes into Rory’s room to find her asleep. She takes away the books from Rory and covers her. She holds up a Harvard brochure and we see Rory’s room has posters of places from Europe up.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know. One minute it’s ‘pass the pot roast’ the next minute it’s ‘hey, here’s have a pile of money’. Things are never boring at the Gilmore house.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What did Rory say when you told her?

speaker: LORELAI
words: She was asleep when I got home.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Hi, for that much money you wake her up! You hire a singing telegram! Women jump out of cakes! People dress up like bankers and dance around with those toasters!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well she’s been working her butt off all week on this Chilton paper, so I let her sleep and I’ll tell her tonight.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Call her now. Ooh, page her, or page her and have her call my cell phone and we can sing the money song from ‘Cabaret’. You be Liza, I’ll be Joel.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t want to bother her while she’s at school. I can never decide, carnations tacky or trendy?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You don’t want to tell her.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh well I understand the hesitation.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Absolutely. I mean who wants to be the bearer of good news. All that hugging and happiness - nightmare.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I was, I was thrilled when Gran told me about it and I was going to tell Rory about it right away.

speaker: LORELAI
words: ...cornered me by the door saying all this stuff about how when Rory gets the money she’s not going to need me and she’s gonna move out of the house sooner.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know it is, it’s crazy and yet...

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Honey come on. The woman’s just trying to mess with your mind, you know that.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: She just doesn’t want to lose control of you. She wants you to be permanently obligated to her.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: So then what? You don’t believe what she said do you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t know. I mean you’re right - what you’re saying about she wants to mess with my mind and make me feel obligated but I mean, what if the money does change our relationship?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I couldn’t stand that. I like things the way they are now.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Lorelai, this is Rory we’re talking about.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: She’s like the most unmaterialistic kid in the world.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Not it’s not about what she would buy. I don’t care if she buys a house or a boat or the elephant man’s bones. It’s just that - you know, it’s about the freedom. I mean if I had access to all that money as a kid I would have left the house so fast.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No I mean - God I know this is crazy. I have my mother’s voice stuck in my head. It’s like that annoying Cranberries song. I hate that I let her do this! I have that I let her get to me!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well then don’t let her. Call Rory and tell her about the money and you’ll see that nothing will be any different.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t want her to go to Europe without me. That was going to be our thing.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: She’s not going to go without you. I promise.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey - [looks at Sookie’s watch] Aw! No! I’ve got to go home.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I have to change and go to tea with Gran and the cast of ‘Gaslight’.

speaker: RICHARD
words: You’re hysterical, I can’t talk to you when you’re hysterical.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I am tired of fighting about this.

speaker: EMILY
words: You have to got to get her to take that offer back.

speaker: EMILY
words: Richard Gilmore I have put up with a lot from this woman over the years...

speaker: EMILY
words: But this time she’s gone too far!

speaker: RICHARD
words: If I do as you ask, I’ll be insulting my mother. I will not do that.

speaker: EMILY
words: Now you listen to me. I don’t care if she demeans me and looks down on me. I don’t care if she thinks I’ve tarnished the Gilmore name. I don’t care if she thinks I’m the whore of Babylon. I’ve long ago given up any hope of getting into her psychotic good graces, but that woman is horrible and selfish. And she’s not going to get away with it. I won’t let her.

speaker: RICHARD
words: This is my mother you’re talking about.

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes it is. Your mother, the one who stepped in without being asked and single-handedly wrecked everything!

speaker: EMILY

words: Yeah, well, it's just my way of saying thanks for helping out Rune.

words: Anyway, when he lost his job, he couldn't pay his rent so then he got evicted. None of this was known to us when he came to stay with Jackson. I mean, but this is the situation. words: Well, this looks like this could be a great place.

words: Yeah it really does. God. A little paint, some pretty curtains, 150 thousand dollars of construction. We're open for business.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Did you always want to own an inn?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh no, I was still dreaming of owning a red Camaro when Rory appeared on the scene.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's a new idea in the last couple years actually. How about you? Did you always want to be a photographer?

speaker: RACHEL
words: Not specifically. I just remember growing up thinking I want to be anywhere but here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, that was you in the other room.

speaker: RACHEL
words: I made sure to pick something that would keep me moving, constantly.

speaker: RACHEL
words: It is. Tiring too. And now that I'm here, back with Luke, I don't know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Things seem to be going pretty well for you guys.

speaker: RACHEL
words: I guess. But I tell you, these last couple weeks, it's become increasingly apparent to me that things just can't continue the way they've been.

speaker: RACHEL
words: I mean, I think it's time we get serious. I'm ready to settle down, I guess, is the creepy old fashion term for it. Pretty damn scary, huh?
(Emily and Rory are walking through Stars Hollow.)

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes, what a shame your grandfather isn't here. He'd fall in love with me all over again.
(Emily and Rory walk in through the front door.)

speaker: EMILY
words: I think we came in through the storeroom.

speaker: RORY
words: You have to dig but you can find some great stuff here.

speaker: EMILY
words: This is ridiculous. No one can run a quality business like this. This place is dusty and disorganized and you can't possibly. . . . Oh now that is gorgeous. Look at the woodwork. It's exquisite. I wonder if it has mate.

speaker: RORY
words: Grandma, look at this. It's got like little flowers all over it.

speaker: RORY
words: Lane, this is my grandma. Grandma, this is my friend Lane.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, I've heard a lot about you.

speaker: LANE
words: It's nice to meet you. Uh, Rory can I talk to you for a sec?

speaker: EMILY
words: Go, talk. I have a lot of looking to do here.
(Rory and Lane walk to the kitchen.)

speaker: LANE
words: It's been a week since that party, and still he has not called.

speaker: LANE
words: A tiny perfect Korean girl that his parents would love and approve of.

speaker: RORY
words: Lane, you are a tiny perfect Korean girl that his parents would love and approve of.

speaker: LANE
words: Know that I listen to the wrong music and wish I could go blond without looking like an idiot. Or that I'd take a whopper over kimchi in a heartbeat.

speaker: LANE
words: So he doesn't like me, he's not gonna call. It's not the end of the world. I'll live. I'll go one. There's always college. Unless my parents get their way, and then it's 'I take thee Jesus to be my lawful wedded husband.'

speaker: RORY
words: Lane, with all due respect to your fiancé, Henry will call.

speaker: RORY
words: Well then why did he talk to you all night. .

speaker: RORY
words: . . and follow you around everywhere you went. .

speaker: RORY
words: . .and ask you to dance six times?

speaker: RORY
words: It was six times. And he did not ask you to dance six times because you're a good dancer, because to tell you the truth and as much as I love you, you're not.

speaker: RORY
words: You are an embarrassment to the art of dancing.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: That's mid nineteenth century, four different kinds of wood.
(Cut to Mrs. Kim and Emily bartering over a cabinet. Lane and Rory watch them from the kitchen.)

speaker: EMILY
words: I thought it was missing an inlay.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, they're nice, but they're certainly not that nice.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Not a better pair on the East Coast.

speaker: EMILY
words: It hardly matters where I'm from. I know these pieces are overpriced.

speaker: EMILY
words: How do I know that's authentic?

speaker: LANE
words: It's like watching the Williams' sisters.
(Emily and Rory walk out of Kim's Antiques)

speaker: EMILY
words: I like that woman. And you know what? I like these shoes.

speaker: RORY
words: You're becoming one of us Grandma.
(Michel walks through the lobby as Rune walks through the front door carrying a duffel bag.)

speaker: RUNE
words: Yeah, I need to know where my room is.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Uh, are you sure you are in the right place? Perhaps you want the YMCA or the local bus station.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Hm, I do not think so. You see, we have standards, and even if they were much much lower, you would still be poor boy out of luck.

speaker: RUNE
words: I'm the new handyman. Lorelai hired me

speaker: RUNE
words: Yeah, but hey, don't spread it around, it's not one of my shining moments.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Yeah, and you probably have so many to pick from.

speaker: MICHEL
words: You've caught me to the quick, out of here teeny tiny man.

speaker: RUNE
words: Look I will only be pushed so far.

speaker: RUNE
words: Finally. Will you tell this guy who I am?

speaker: LORELAI
words: He's gonna be our new handyman.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What! No, I didn't date him. Rune, I didn't date you. It was one night. .

speaker: MICHEL
words: One night, you and him together?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. Listen, Rune, here, come with me, I'll show you where you're gonna stay.

speaker: RUNE
words: Can you ask your bellboy here to grab my stuff? I think I might've sprained my shoulder on the way over here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Relax. I got it. (picks up the duffel bag) Uh. Geez. Move it Rune.
(Lorelai and Rune leave. Emily and Rory walk through the front door.)

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, I think it's very nice.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom's office is right back there. Oh and you have to see the dining room. They got the chandeliers from one of Martha Washington's houses.

speaker: EMILY
words: Do you spend a lot of time here?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah. I work here a couple afternoons a week, and I help out with special occasions. They have a lot of weddings here. I wonder where mom is.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh, don't bother your mother. I'm sure she's busy.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh no, she'd want to say hi.
(Rory and Emily walk over to Michel, who is behind the front desk.)

speaker: MICHEL
words: Small, dark, wanted in four states.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, well, do you know when she's coming back because my grandmother's here and we want to say hi.

speaker: EMILY
words: J'adore Paris. Nous y allons chaque printemps.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Oh, oui, le printemps à Paris...

speaker: MICHEL
words: C'est si vrai, c'est si vrai...

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, well, we better go find mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: It's been a pleasure meeting you.
(Emily and Rory walk towards the center of the lobby.)

speaker: RORY
words: Uh okay. (sees Lorelai ahead) Mom, hi.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, it's quite a place you've got here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, well it's not really my place, I just work here, so. . I thought you were gonna go antiquing.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah we did. And then we had lunch.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I can't picture you at Teriyaki Joe's . . .or in jogging shoes. What's up working girl?

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, Rory decided that we should take the grand tour of the town; that meant walking. I hope you don't mind, I borrowed your socks also.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, I don't mind. I wish I had a camera, but I don't mind.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm gonna go show her the grounds.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yeah, good. On the way back, show her the gym. Jump on the treadmill.
(Lorelai walks over to the front desk.)
(Rory and Emily are walking along the pond on the inn's grounds.)

speaker: RORY
words: So the horses are up on that hill, and the tennis courts are over there.

speaker: RORY
words: And this is my favorite place.

speaker: RORY
words: No, this is where we used to live.

speaker: RORY
words: Right when mom and I moved here, this was our apartment.
(Rory opens the door and walks in. Emily looks in from the doorway.)

speaker: RORY
words: I know it's looks small, but it's really pretty. Come on. See we had our bed right over there, and mom put up this really pretty curtain around the tub so that it looked like a real bathroom. And we would just sit outside at night when the Inn would have parties and we'd just listen to music and feed the ducks and. . . (Emily walks away) Grandma? Grandma wait, what's the matter?

speaker: RORY
words: Did something happen? Are you sick? Is it the teriyaki?

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm fine. Its just getting late, I have to go.
(Rory watches as Emily walks away. Rune walks towards the shed carrying some sheets.)

speaker: RORY
words: What? Oh sorry. (She moves out of the way so that Rune can go into the shed.)
(Lorelai walks down a hallway and knocks on a door that says "Williams Hardware, Office, Private". Rachel answers the door.)

speaker: RACHEL
words: Hey! Good, you got my message.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hail the glory of the answering machine.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Come on in. (Lorelai walks inside) I just developed some shots of the Dragonfly I think you're gonna love. Maybe they can help inspire you a little more.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, great! Hm, I've never been in Luke's apartment before.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Really? How long have you two known each other?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh god, years. But our relationship is strictly "Please can I have coffee?", 'No,', 'Come on!, 'No, it makes you short.' Blah blah blah.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Well, then let me give you the grand tour. This, is it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's, uh, not how I pictured it. I mean, not that I've been picturing Luke's apartment. I haven't been picturing it at all.
(Lorelai walks over to the window and touches the curtains.)

speaker: RACHEL
words: Nope. Frankly, a little too frilly for my taste.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm gonna give him so much crap about that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thanks. (sits down on the couch) Man, you guys are living in pretty tight quarters here.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Well this was originally his dad's office, so it was never really meant for anyone to actually live in.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you think about moving to a bigger place?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No? Oh right. Because tight quarters, romantic. Hello Lorelai.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Yeah, well I don't think romance has a lot to do with it.

speaker: RACHEL
words: I'm not sure I'm gonna be in Stars Hollow much longer.

speaker: RACHEL
words: I know, I just, I can't seem to make Luke believe that I really want to stay this time.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Did you tell him all that stuff you told me?

speaker: RACHEL
words: Till I was blue in the face.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well you just have to keep trying until he hears you.
(Rachel sits down next to Lorelai on the couch.)

speaker: RACHEL
words: Hey, I don't blame him. I've given him no reason to believe me. I just hope that magically somehow he'd, I don't know, forget that I'd skipped out on him a million times before.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Have you told him that you're thinking of leaving?

speaker: RACHEL
words: I don't know. I mean, I feel like I've been trying so hard to make everything good. But this town, you know, it's like living under a microscope. Everyone here is just waiting for you to screw up.

speaker: RACHEL
words: I don't know how long I can stick around here waiting for Luke when I feel like I don't have a friend in the world.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, if you can French braid hair, I'll be your friend.

speaker: RACHEL
words: I cannot find your pictures here. They must be in the bathroom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So do not wanna know why.
(Rachel starts walking towards the bathroom, then stops and turns around.)

speaker: RACHEL
words: Hey, I know this is not so not cool to ask. But if the situation comes up and it's not too weird, a little word of encouragement from you might help a lot.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, yeah, sure. If it comes up.
(Rachel goes into the bathroom. Luke walks in the front door.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. And go through your underwear drawer.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's a nice place you have here.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, yeah, Rachel picked them out.

words: Hi. I just had to put something in the safe.

words: I told him about the underwear drawer.

speaker: RACHEL
words: And the baseball cap fashion show?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I think he's going to buy a matching rug.
(Lane and Rory are lying on Rory's bed)

speaker: RORY
words: I like this song. It makes me gloomy.

speaker: LANE
words: Like Joy Division Gloomy? Nick Cave gloomy? Robert Smith gloomy?

speaker: LANE
words: So kind of like a San Quentin-y, it's a long road home and my horse just got shot but I've still got my girl by my side gloomy?

speaker: LANE
words: I'm deep in a Charlie Parker gloomy.

speaker: RORY
words: He did? Why didn't you tell me?

speaker: LANE
words: Well I didn't talk to him. He left a message. I listened to it eight-and-a-half times, but then my mom came home and I had to erase it. But I was so panicked that I broke it, which is better because now all evidence that a boy called me is in the trash.

speaker: LANE
words: Well it was a good message the first couple times. Then I started parsing it for subtext.

speaker: LANE
words: He said, and I quote, "Hey Lane, it's Henry." Not a good start.

speaker: LANE
words: It's so gender neutral. It's how you start a conversation with a bowling pal.

speaker: LANE
words: Then he said "It was fun meeting you the other night."

speaker: LANE
words: He didn't say which night. Like he didn't remember which night. Like he's mixing me up with another girl from another night. For all I know, he thought he was calling the hot blonde he met at a hopped up night at Balthazar's.

speaker: RORY
words: He's a 16 year old Korean boy.

speaker: LANE
words: Or so he led me to believe.

speaker: LANE
words: Okay, the bottom line is that he wants me to call him back. But if I do that then he's probably gonna ask me out on a date. And if we go out on a date then it could lead to another date, and then I'll have to introduce him to my parents. And once I do that, they're gonna like him. Because he's Korean and he's gonna be a doctor. And then once that happens, that's it. It'll be over. He'll be hideous to me. Now I'm a Lou Reed gloomy.

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory, hello. Do you have a minute?

words: Now I know this will probably seem silly but I was wondering what your favorite color is.

words: Oh, I don't really have one. Blue I guess.

words: Okay. What about flowers? Do you like flowers?

speaker: EMILY
words: Which would you say you like better, roses or lilies?

words: Sunflowers it is. Now, what about music? N'sync or 98 degrees?

words: What kind of sick joke is this?

words: I don't think I could choose.

words: What about that other group? The Backside Boys?

speaker: RORY
words: Um, I guess if I really had to choose, I'd say N'sync.

speaker: EMILY
words: You'll see. I'm looking forward to dinner on Friday.

speaker: LANE
words: Sounded like some sick take on the Gallup survey. I gotta go

words: I already left him a message, he's probably parsing it right now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, yeah coffee would be great.
(Luke fills up a carryout cup and hands it to her.)

words: Yeah. Wow, it really looks, um, different from back here, ya know? All this is yours, as far as the eye can see.

words: Yes, it's quite an empire I've built for myself. I'm thinking of conquering the flower shop next door and expanding the freezer.

words: Hey, I didn't mean to kick you out of your own apartment.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, you guys looks like you were talking girl talk.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You didn't like me being up there?
